units.syllabus_heading: Laws of motion and work, energy and power
units.topics_html:
• Law of conservation of linear momentum and its applications
  • Static and kinetic friction, laws of friction, rolling friction, lubrication
  • Work done by a constant force and a variable force; kinetic energy, work-energy theorem, power
  • Conservative forces: Conservation of mechanical energy (kinetic and potential energies), non-conservative forces: Motion in a vertical circle, elastic and inelastic collisions in one and two dimensions

• Elastic behaviour, stress-strain relationship, Hooke's law, Young's modulus, bulk modulus, shear modulus of rigidity, Poisson's ratio, elastic energy
  • Viscosity, Stokes' law, terminal velocity, streamline and turbulent flow, critical velocity
  • Bernoulli's theorem and its applications
  • Heat, temperature, thermal expansion: Thermal expansion of solids, specific heat capacity: Cp, Cv-latent heat capacity
  • Qualitative ideas of blackbody radiation: Wein's displacement law, Stefan's law

• Charges and their conservation; Coulomb’s law-forces between two point electric charges, forces between multiple electric charges-superposition principle
  • Electric field, electric field due to a point charge, electric field lines; electric dipole, electric field intensity due to a dipole, behaviour of a dipole in a uniform electric field
  • Electric potential, potential difference-electric potential due to a point charge and dipole, equipotential surfaces, electrical potential energy of a system of two point charges
  • Electric flux, Gauss’s theorem and its applications
  • Electrostatic induction, capacitor and capacitance, dielectric and electric polarisation, parallel plate capacitor with and without dielectric medium, applications of capacitor, energy stored in a capacitor, capacitors in series and in parallel
  • Action of points, Van de Graaff generator

• Electric current, flow of charges in a metallic conductor, drift velocity and mobility and their relation with electric current
  • Ohm’s law, electrical resistance, V-I characteristics, electrical resistivity and conductivity, classification of materials in terms of conductivity, carbon resistors, colour code for carbon resistors, combination of resistors, series and parallel
  • Temperature dependence of resistance, internal resistance of a cell, potential difference and EMF of a cell, combinations of cells in series and in parallel
  • Kirchoff’s law, Wheatstone’s bridge and its application for temperature coefficient of resistance measurement, metre bridge, special case of Wheatstone bridge, potentiometer principle, comparing the EMF of two cells

• Magnetic effect of electric current, concept of magnetic field, Oersted’s experiment, Biot-Savart law, magnetic field due to an infinitely long current carrying straight wire and circular coil, tangent galvanometer, construction and working
  • Bar magnet as an equivalent solenoid, magnetic field lines
  • Ampere’s circuital law and its application
  • Force on a moving charge in uniform magnetic field and electric field, cyclotron, force on current carrying conductor in a uniform magnetic field, forces between two parallel current carrying conductors, definition of ampere
  • Torque experienced by a current loop in a uniform magnetic field, moving coil galvanometer, conversion to ammeter and voltmeter, current loop as a magnetic dipole and its magnetic dipole moment, magnetic dipole moment of a revolving electron

• Electromagnetic induction, Faraday’s law, induced EMF and current, Lenz’s law
  • Self induction, mutual induction, self inductance of a long solenoid, mutual inductance of two long solenoids
  • Methods of inducing EMF-(i) by changing magnetic induction, (ii) by changing area enclosed by the coil and, (iii) by changing the orientation of the coil (quantitative treatment)
  • A.C. generator, commercial generator
  • Single phase, three phase
  • Eddy current-applications, transformer-long distance transmission
  • Alternating current-measurement of A.C., A.C. circuit with resistance, A.C. circuit with inductor, A.C. circuit with capacitor, LCR series circuit, resonance and Q-factor, power in A.C. circuits

• Reflection of light, spherical mirrors, mirror formula
  • Refraction of light, total internal reflection and its applications, optical fibers, refraction at spherical surfaces, lenses, thin lens formula, lens maker’s formula
  • Magnification, power of a lens, combination of thin lenses in contact, combination of a lens and a mirror
  • Refraction and dispersion of light through a prism
  • Scattering of light-blue colour of sky and reddish appearances of the sun at sunrise and sunset
  • Wavefront and Huygens’s principle-reflection, total internal reflection and refraction of plane wave at a plane surface using wavefronts
  • Interference, Young’s double slit experiment and expression for fringe width, coherent source, interference of light, formation of colours in thin films, Newton’s rings
  • Diffraction-differences between interference and diffraction of light, diffraction grating
  • Polarisation of light waves, polarisation by reflection, Brewster’s law, double refraction, Nicol prism, uses of plane polarised light and polaroids, rotatory polarisation, polarimeter

units.syllabus_heading: Dual nature of radiation and atomic physics
units.topics_html:
• Electromagnetic waves and their characteristics, electromagnetic spectrum, photoelectric effect, light waves and photons, Einstein’s photoelectric equation, laws of photoelectric emission, particle nature of light, photo cells and their applications
  • Atomic structure, discovery of the electron, specific charge (Thomson’s method) and charge of the electron (Millikan’s oil drop method), alpha scattering, Rutherford’s atom model

• Nuclear properties, nuclear radii, masses, binding energy, density, charge, isotopes, isobars and isotones, nuclear mass defect, binding energy, stability of nuclei, Bainbridge mass spectrometer
  • Nature of nuclear forces, neutron-discovery, properties, artificial transmutation, particle accelerator
  • Radioactivity, alpha, beta and gamma radiations and their properties, radioactive decay law, half life, mean life, artificial radioactivity, radio isotopes-effects and uses, Geiger-Muller counter
  • Radio carbon dating
  • Nuclear fission, chain reaction, atom bomb, nuclear reactor, nuclear fusion, hydrogen bomb, cosmic rays, elementary particles

• Semiconductor basics, energy band in solids: Difference between metals, insulators and semiconductors, semiconductor doping, intrinsic and extrinsic semiconductors
  • Formation of P-N Junction, barrier potential and depletion layer, P-N Junction diode, forward and reverse bias characteristics, diode as a rectifier, Zener diode, Zener diode as a voltage regulator, LED
  • Junction transistors-characteristics, transistor as a switch, transistor as an amplifier, transistor as an oscillator
  • Logic gates, NOT, OR, AND, EXOR using discrete components, NAND and NOR gates as universal gates, De Morgan’s theorem, laws and theorems of Boolean algebra

• Bohr’s atomic model, Sommerfeld’s extension of atomic structure; electronic configuration and quantum numbers; shapes of s, p, d, f orbitals, Pauli’s exclusion principle, Hund’s Rule of maximum multiplicity, Aufbau principle
  • Emission and absorption spectra, line and band spectra; hydrogen spectrum, Lyman, Balmer, Paschen, Brackett and Pfund series; De-Broglie’s theory; Heisenberg’s uncertainty principle, wave nature of electron, Schrodinger wave equation (no derivation)
  • Eigen values and Eigen functions
  • Hybridization of atomic orbitals involving s, p, and d orbitals

• p-block elements, phosphorous compounds; PCl, PCl oxides
  • Hydrogen halides, interhalogen compounds
  • Xenon fluoride compounds
  • General characteristics of d-block elements, electronic configuration, oxidation states of first row transition elements and their colours
  • Occurrence and principles of extraction: Copper, silver, gold and zinc
  • Preparation and properties of CuSO, AgNO and KCrO
  • Lanthanides-introduction, electronic configuration, general characteristics, oxidation state, lanthanide contraction, uses, brief comparison of lanthanides and actinides

units.syllabus_heading: Coordination chemistry and solid state chemistry
units.topics_html:
• Introduction, terminology in coordination chemistry, IUPAC nomenclature of mononuclear coordination compounds
  • Isomerism, geometrical isomerism in 4-coordinate, 6-coordinate complexes
  • Theories on coordination compounds, Werner’s theory (brief), valence bond theory
  • Uses of coordination compounds
  • Bioinorganic compounds (Haemoglobin and chlorophyll)
  • Lattice, unit cell, systems, types of crystals, packing in solids; ionic crystals, imperfections in solids, point defects
  • X-ray diffraction, electrical property, amorphous solids (elementary ideas only)

units.syllabus_heading: Thermodynamics, chemical equilibrium and chemical kinetics
units.topics_html:
• I and II law of thermodynamics, spontaneous and non spontaneous processes, entropy, Gibb’s free energy, free energy change and chemical equilibrium, significance of entropy
  • Law of mass action, Le Chatlier’s principle, applications of chemical equilibrium
  • Rate expression, order and molecularity of reactions, zero order, first order and pseudo first order reaction, half life period
  • Determination of rate constant and order of reaction
  • Temperature dependence of rate constant, Arrhenius equation and activation energy

• Theory of electrical conductance; metallic and electrolytic conductance
  • Faraday’s laws, theory of strong electrolytes, specific resistance, specific conductance, equivalent and molar conductance, variation of conductance with dilution, Kohlrausch’s law, ionic product of water, pH and pH, buffer solutions, use of pH values
  • Cells, electrodes and electrode potentials, construction of cell and EMF values, fuel cells, corrosion and its prevention

• Definition, classification-structural isomerism, stereo isomerism, geometrical and optical isomerism
  • Optical activity, chirality, compounds containing chiral centres, R, S notation, D, L notation

• Nomenclature of alcohols, classification of alcohols, distinction between 1º, 2º and 3º alcohols, general methods of preparation of primary alcohols, properties
  • Methods of preparation of dihydric alcohols: Glycol-properties, uses
  • Methods of preparation of trihydric alcohols-properties, uses
  • Aromatic alcohols, preparation and properties of phenols and benzyl alcohol
  • Ethers, nomenclature of ethers, general methods of preparation of aliphatic ethers-properties, uses
  • Aromatic ethers, preparation of anisole-uses

• Nomenclature of carbonyl compounds, comparison of aldehydes and ketones
  • General methods of preparation of aldehydes-properties, uses
  • Aromatic aldehydes-preparation of benzaldehyde-properties and uses
  • Ketones, general methods of preparation of aliphatic ketones (acetone)-properties, uses
  • Aromatic ketones, preparation of acetophenone-properties, uses, preparation of benzophenone-properties
  • Name reactions; Clemmenson reduction, Wolff –Kishner reduction, Cannizzaro reaction, Claisen Schmidt reaction, Benzoin condensation, Aldol condensation
  • Preparation and applications of Grignard reagents

• Nomenclature, preparation of aliphatic monocarboxylic acids, formic acid-properties, uses
  • Monohydroxy mono carboxylic acids; Lactic acid, synthesis of lactic acid
  • Aliphatic dicarboxylic acids; preparation of oxalic and succinic acids
  • Aromatic acids; benzoic and salicylic acids-properties, uses
  • Derivatives of carboxylic acids; acetyl chloride (CHCOCl)-preparation, properties, uses
  • Preparation of acetamide, properties, acetic anhydride-preparation, properties
  • Preparation of esters, methyl acetate-properties

• Aliphatic nitro compounds, preparation of aliphatic nitroalkanes-properties, uses
  • Aromatic nitro compounds-preparation, properties, uses
  • Distinction between aliphatic and aromatic nitro compounds
  • Amines; aliphatic amines, general methods of preparation, properties, distinction between 1º, 2º and 3º amines
  • Aromatic amines, synthesis of benzylamine-properties, aniline-preparation, properties, uses
  • Differences between aliphatic and aromatic amines
  • Aliphatic nitriles-preparation, properties, uses
  • Diazonium salts, preparation of benzene diazoniumchloride-properties
  • Carbohydrates: Distinction between sugars and non sugars, structural formulae of glucose, fructose and sucrose, with their linkages, invert sugar-definition, examples of oligo and polysaccharides
  • Amino acids: Classification with examples, peptides-properties of peptide bond
  • Lipids: Definition, classification with examples, difference between fats, oils and waxes

• Adjoint, inverse-properties, computation of inverses, solution of system of linear equations by matrix inversion method
  • Rank of a matrix, elementary transformation on a matrix, consistency of a system of linear equations, Cramer’s rule, non-homogeneous equations, homogeneous linear system and rank method
  • Solution of linear programming problems (LPP) in two variables

• Definition, range, domain, principal value branch, graphs of inverse trigonometric functions and their elementary properties
  • Complex number system, conjugate, properties, ordered pair representation
  • Modulus-properties, geometrical representation, polar form, principal value, conjugate, sum, difference, product, quotient, vector interpretation, solutions of polynomial equations, De Moivre’s theorem and its applications
  • Roots of a complex number-nth roots, cube roots, fourth roots

• Definition of a conic, general equation of a conic, classification with respect to the general equation of a conic, classification of conics with respect to eccentricity
  • Equations of conic sections (parabola, ellipse and hyperbola) in standard forms and general forms, directrix, focus and latus-rectum, parametric form of conics and chords
  • Tangents and normals, Cartesian form and parametric form, equation of chord of contact of tangents from a point (x1 ,y1) to all the above said curves
  • Asymptotes, rectangular hyperbola, standard equation of a rectangular hyperbola

• Scalar product, angle between two vectors, properties of scalar product, and applications of dot product
  • Vector Product, right handed and left handed systems, properties of vector product, applications of cross product
  • Product of three vectors, scalar triple product, properties of scalar triple product, vector triple product, vector product of four vectors, scalar product of four vectors

• Direction cosines, direction ratios, equation of a straight line passing through a given point and parallel to a given line, passing through two given points, angle between two lines
  • Planes, equation of a plane, passing through a given point and perpendicular to a line, given the distance from the origin and unit normal, passing through a given point and parallel to two given lines
  • Passing through two given points and parallel to a given line, passing through three given non-collinear points, passing through the line of intersection of two given planes, the distance between a point and a plane
  • The plane which contains two given lines (co-planar lines), angle between a line and a plane
  • Skew lines, shortest distance between two lines, condition for two lines to intersect, point of intersection, collinearity of three points
  • Sphere, equation of the sphere whose centre and radius are given, equation of a sphere when the extremities of the diameter are given

• Limits, continuity and differentiability of functions, derivative as a rate of change, velocity, acceleration, related rates, derivative as a measure of slope, tangent, normal and angle between curves
  • Mean value theorem, Rolle’s theorem, Lagrange mean value theorem, Taylor’s and Maclaurin’s series, L’ Hospital’s rule, stationary points, increasing, decreasing, maxima, minima, concavity, convexity and points of inflexion
  • Errors and approximations-absolute, relative, percentage errors -curve tracing, partial derivatives, Euler’s theorem

• Simple definite integrals, fundamental theorems of calculus, properties of definite integrals
  • Reduction formulae, reduction formulae for ∫sin n x dxand ∫cos n x dx, Bernoulli’s formula
  • Area of bounded regions, length of the curve

• Differential equations, formation of differential equations, order and degree, solving differential equations (1st order), variables separable, homogeneous, linear equations and applications
  • Second order linear differential equations, second order linear differential equations with constant co-efficients, finding the particular integral if f(x) = e mx, sin mx, cos mx, x, x²

• Probability, axioms, addition law, conditional probability, multiplicative law, Baye’s theorem, random variable, probability density function, distribution function, mathematical expectation, variance
  • Theoretical distributions, discrete distributions (binomial, Poisson distributions), continuous distributions (normal distribution)

• Functions, relations, sequence and series (A.P., G.P., H.P.), binomial theorem, basics of counting
  • Mathematical logic, logical statements, connectives, truth tables, logical equivalence, tautology, contradiction
  • Groups-binary operations, semi groups, monoids, groups, order of a group, order of an element, properties of groups

• Need for classification; three domains of life
  • Linnaean, Whittaker, Bentham and Hooker systems of classification
  • Salient features and classification of non-chordates up to phyla levels and chordates up to class levels
  • Morphology and anatomy of flowering plants
  • Structural organization in insects (cockroach)

• Cell theory
  • Prokaryotic cell and it’s ultrastructure
  • Eukaryotic cell-cell wall, cell membrane, cytoskeleton, nucleus, chloroplast, mitochondria, endoplasmic reticulum, Golgi bodies, ribosomes, lysosomes, vacuoles and centrosomes
  • Cell cycle and division-amitosis, mitosis and meiosis
  • Search for genetic material; structure of DNA and RNA; replication, transcription, genetic code, translation, splicing, gene expression and regulation (lac operon) and DNA repair

• Asexual reproduction-binary fission, sporulation, budding, gemmule formation and fragmentation
  • Vegetative propagation in plants, sexual reproduction in flowering plants and structure of flowers
  • Pollination, fertilization, development of seeds and fruits, seed dispersal, apomixis, parthenocarpy and poly-embryony
  • Human reproductive system
  • Gametogenesis, menstrual cycle, fertilization, implantation, embryo development upto blastocyst formation, pregnancy, parturition and lactation
  • Assisted reproductive technologies

• Chromosomes-structure and types, linkage and crossing over, recombination of chromosomes, mutation and chromosomal aberrations
  • Mendelian inheritance, chromosomal theory of inheritance, deviation from Mendelian ratio (incomplete dominance, co-dominance, multiple allelism, pleiotrophy), sex linked inheritance and sex determination in humans
  • Darwinism, neo Darwinism, Hardy and Weinberg’s principle and factors affecting the equilibrium: Selection, mutation, migration and random genetic drift

• Pathogens, parasites causing human diseases (malaria, dengue, chickengunia, filariasis, ascariasis, typhoid, pneumonia, common cold, amoebiasis, ring worm) and their control
  • Basic concepts of immunology, vaccines, antibiotics, cancer, HIV and AIDS
  • Adolescence, drug and alcohol abuse

• Structure and function of carbohydrates, lipids and proteins
  • Enzymes-types, properties and enzyme action
  • Metabolism-glycolysis, fermentation, Kreb’s cycle and pentose phosphate pathway

• Movement of water, food, nutrients, gases and minerals
  • Passive diffusion, facilitated diffusion, and active transport
  • Imbibition, osmosis, apoplast and symplast transport and guttation
  • Macro and micronutrients and their deficiency symptoms
  • Transpiration, photosynthesis (light 2 and dark reactions) and electron transport chain
  • Hormones and growth regulators, photo-periodism and vernalization
  • Nitrogen cycle and biological nitrogen fixation

• Digestion and absorption, breathing and respiration, body fluids and circulation, excretory system, endocrine system, nervous system, skeletal and muscular systems
  • Locomotion and movement, growth, aging and death
  • Hormones-types of hormones, functions and disorders

• Recombinant DNA technology, applications in health, agriculture and industries; genetically modified organisms; human insulin, vaccine and antibiotic production
  • Stem cell technology and gene therapy
  • Apiculture and animal husbandry
  • Plant breeding, tissue culture, single cell protein, fortification, Bt crops and transgenic animals
  • Microbes in food processing, sewage treatment, waste management and energy generation
  • Biocontrol agents and biofertilizers
  • Biosafety issues, biopiracy and patents
  • Human and rice genome projects
  • DNA fingerprinting

• Ecosystems: Components, types, pyramids, nutrient cycles (carbon and phosphorous), ecological succession and energy flow in an ecosystem; biodiversity-concepts, patterns, importance, conservation, hot spots, endangered organisms, extinction, Red data book
  • Ecosystems: Biodiversity-botanical gardens, national parks, sanctuaries, museums, biosphere reserves and Ramsar sites
  • Environmental issues: Pollution and its control. Solid and radioactive waste management. Climate change impact and its mitigation. Population attributes-growth, birth and death rate and age distribution
• Short passage or line of poems

exam_name: IIITH PGEE - International Institute of Information Technology Hyderabad Postgraduate Entrance Examination

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
IIITH PGEE 2024 - IIIT Hyderabad has released the IITH PGEE 2024 result on the official website. The authority has activated the IIITH PGEE 2024 result link at admportal.iiit.ac.in/admissions.php. The authority condcuted the IIITH PGEE 2024 on May 4, 2024, as a computer-based test for admission to various M.Tech programmess across India. Registration candidate can download the IIITH PGEE 2024 exam admit card from the official website, admportal.iiit.ac.in. Aspirants must refer to the IIITH PGEE exam pattern and syllabus while preparing for the exam. Candidates can also refer to the previous year IIITH PGEE question papers for additional practice questions.

Candidates who wish to appear for the IIITH PGEE 2024 exam have to ensure they fulfil the eligibility criteria. The eligibility criteria of IIITH PGEE 2024 states that candidates should have completed B.E./B.Tech from a recognized institute.

The authority concluded the IIITH PGEE 2024 admission process on April 5, 2024. Candidates could apply for PGEE through the official website pgadmissions.iiit.ac.in/pgee. Candidates who wish to get admission to M.S / M.Tech / PhD programmes had to submit the IIIT PGEE application form 2024 before the last date. The IIITH PGEE 2024 application form was opened on February 20, 2024. Moreover, the authority has released the complete schedule of IIITH PGEE 2024.

IIITH PGEE 2024 Latest news and Updates

  • IIIT PGEE 2024 result has been announced.

  • IIIT PGEE 2024 exam has been concluded.

  • IIIT PGEE 2024 admit card has been issued.

  • The authority has concluded the IIIT PGEE registration process on April 5, 2024.

  • The authority has extended the IIIT PGEE registration date.

  • The authorities have released the IIIT PGEE application form and exam date on the official website.

About IIITH PGEE

International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad (IIITH) was established in 1998 as the first autonomous public-private institute. International Institute of Information Technology Hyderabad Postgraduate Entrance Examination (IIITH PGEE) is conducted for the admission in postgraduate (M.Tech) programmes in IIIT-Hyderabad for the various range of specialisations namely:  Computer Science and Engineering, Computer-Aided Structural Engineering, Computer Science, and Information Technology and Bioinformatics.

highlights.value: International Institute of Information Technology Hyderabad Postgraduate Entrance Examination
International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The authorities have released the IIITH PGEE 2024 eligibility criteria along with the official notification. The eligibility criteria of IIITH PGEE comprise the education qualification required, subject-wise combination required, and other parameters. Candidates who wish to appear for the exam have to check the IIITH PGEE eligibility criteria 2024 before filing the application form. Candidates can check the IIITH PGEE eligibility criteria below.

IIITH PGEE Eligibility Criteria 2024

  • Candidates should have completed B.E./B.Tech/M.E./M.Tech in any of the branches (CSE/EE/ECE/Civil/Biotechnology).

  • Applicants with Masters Degree in Science/Mathematics/Computers/Information Technology/MCA programmes are also eligible to apply for admission.

  • Candidates currently pursuing the last year of their graduation course are also eligible to apply.

application_process.html_content:
IIIT Hyderabad concluded the IIITH PGEE application form on April 5, 2024 on the official website iiit.ac.in. Applicants willing to appear for the entrance exam have to fill out the application form of IIITH PGEE 2024 before the deadline. Earlier, the last date to fill the IIITH PGEEE 2024 application form was April 1. The application process of IIITH PGEE comprises initial registration, filling application form and payment of the application fee. Steps to fill out the IIITH PGEE application form are given below.

How to fill IIITH PGEE application form 2024? 

Candidates have to follow the below-mentioned steps to fill out the IIITH PGEE 2024 application form.

STEP 1 - IIITH PGEE 2024 Registration

Firstly, candidates have to complete the registration process with basic details. Applicants have to enter their name, parent's name, gender, address, mobile number and email address in the IIITH PGEE 2024 registration form. Then, a password has to be created as per the specifications. After successful registration, a one-time password will be sent to the email address provided by the candidate. 

STEP 2 - Filling IIITH PGEE 2024 Application Form

Next, candidates have to fill details in the application form of IIITH PGEE 2024. Details such as communication address, personal details, educational details and other information are required to complete the IIITH PGEE registration form 2024. Candidates then have to provide a statement of purpose, photograph and resume to be uploaded to complete the application form.

STEP 3 - Fees Payment

Lastly, candidates have to pay the IIITH PGEE application fee in online mode. Candidates have to pay Rs. 2000 as the application fees of IIITH PGEE. The payment of application fee will be done in online mode through Credit/Debit Card/Net Banking. It should be noted that candidates have to pay an additional amount of Rs 50 for each additional program applied.

preparation_tips.html_content:
• Candidates willing to appear for IIITH PGEE exam are advised to check the exam pattern and syllabus of IIITH carefully. With the help of IIITH PGEE exam pattern, candidates will get the idea of the type of questions asked in the examination. 

  • A good revision requires candidates to prepare short notes while preparing. Hence, candidates should make sure they note down important points for quick revision during the examination days. 

  • Candidates are also advised to solve as many previous year questions as possible. It will boost their confidence and help them to achieve time management required during the examination.

admit_card.html_content:
IIIT Hyderabad has released the IIITH PGEE admit card 2024 on the official website. Applicants can download the IIITH PGEE 2024 admit card using their user ID and password. The IIITH PGEE admit card includes the candidate's personal details, exam details, exam day instructions and more. Candidates must check all the details mentioned on the IIITH PGEE admit card after downloading it. In case of any discrepancy in the admit card of IIITH PGEE 2024, applicants have to contact the exam authorities. The steps to download the IIITH PGEE admit card are provided below.

How to download the IIITH PGEE admit card 2024?

  • Visit the IIITH PGEE official website.
  • Click on the direct link to download IIITH PGEE hall ticket.
  • Enter User ID and password in the required fields.
  • IIITH PGEE 2024 admit card will be displayed on the screen.
  • Download the admit card and take a printout.

counselling_process.html_content:
IIIT Hyderabad will announce the IIITH PGEE 2024 counselling dates on the official website, pgadmissions.iiit.ac.in/pgee. The IIITH PGEE counselling process will be held in online mode. Applicants who qualify the IIITH PGEE exam will be able to download the IIITH PGEE counselling allotment letters from the official website. Candidates are called for the counselling process and personal interview based on marks secured in the entrance examination. Candidates will have to complete the IIITH PGEE counselling document verification within the specified period.

Candidates will have to appear for the personal interview after completing the IIITH PGEE document verification. Once selected, candidates will have to pay the admission fee in favour of IIIT Hyderabad within the specified time.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The authorities has released the IIITH PGEE 2024 exam pattern through the official notification. Applicants willing to appear for the exam are advised to check the IIITH PGEE exam pattern for their preparations. IIITH PGEE exam pattern 2024 comprises the marking scheme, mode of exam, duration, type of questions and other details. For more details, candidates can refer to the table given below.

IIITH PGEE Exam Pattern 2024

Particulars

Details

Mode of Examination

Online (Computer Based Examination)

Duration of Examination

Three hours.

  • Section I: General aptitude paper - 90 Minutes

  • Section II: Subject paper - 90 Minutes

Type of Questions

Paper I – Objective

Paper II – Objective and Subjective Both

Papers

Paper I: General aptitude paper – Basic Aptitude, Logical Reasoning, Basic Questions on Computer and Mathematics

Paper II – Subject Paper (according to the course selected by the candidates)

Negative Marking

There will be no Negative Marking.

syllabus.main_exam_title: IIITH PGEE 2024 International Institute of Information Technology Hyderabad Postgraduate Entrance Examination 2024

units.syllabus_heading: Basic questions on computers and mathematics

units.topics_html:
• Linear independence, span, basis, orthonormal set, gram-schmidt orthogonalization process, inner product, dual space, eigen space, rank of a matrix
  • Cayley-Hamiltonian theorem, similar matrices, linear operator, hermetian, unitary and normal matrices, spectral decomposition
• Basic concepts of groups, cyclic group, cosets, elementary concepts of rings and field
• Concepts of sets of real numbers, sequence of real numbers, continuous and diﬀerentiable functions, rolle’s theorem, mean value theorem and taylor se- ries, reimann integration
• Conditional probability, bayes theorem, random variable, pdf and cdf, moment generating function, theoretical distribution (binomial, poisson, nor- mal, uniform and hyper geometric)
• Equation of first order and first degree, second order linear equation with constant coeﬃcients
• Linear programming problem

units.syllabus_heading: Basic data structures (arrays, lists, stacks, and queues)
Capability to write programs in c or c++ is expected

units.topics_html: • Nodal and mesh analysis, wye-delta transformation, steady state sinusoidal analysis, time and frequency domain analysis of rlc circuits, laplace transformations, 2-port networks, transfer functions
• Theory and characteristics of diodes such as junction and zener etc, transistors such as bjt, jfet, and mosfet etc, photodiodes
• Small signal models and applications of diodes, bjts, mosfets, biasing of transistors, types of amplifiers, op-amp circuits, filters, oscillators, function generators and wave-shaping circuits
• Boolean algebra, logic gates, logic families, combinational, arithmetic, memory and sequential circuits, adc, microprocessors and microcontrollers

• Components of control systems, open and closed loop control systems, stability analysis, routh-hurwitz criteria, signal flow graphs
  • Transient and steady state analysis of lti control systems including frequency response, root loci, bode and nyquist plots, lead and lag compensation, pid control

• Classification of signals, lti system analysis, system properties, fourier series, fourier transform, discrete time fourier series , laplace transform, z-transform, system transfer function, fourier analysis of lti systems, sampling theorem

• Random variables, probability distribution function, probability density function, conditional probability, bayes theorem, central limit theorem
  • Functions of random variables, random processes, stationary random processes, auto-correlation and cross-correlation functions, power spectrum
• Analog and digital modulation and demodulation, super heterodyne receivers, quantization, line coding, matched filters, receiver structures in the presence of awgn, probability of error
• Discrete fourier transform, fft, z-transform, z-domain analysis of lti systems, circular convolution, design of digital iir and fir filters

subjects.subject_name: Civil engineering-Hydraulics and Water Resources Engineering

units.topics_html: • Atomic structure, theory of gases, chemical thermodynamics, chemical and phase equilibria, electrochemistry, chemical kinetics
• Basic concepts in organic chemistry and stereo chemistry, aromaticity and huckel's rule, heterocyclic chemistry, qualitative organic analysis
• Periodic table, chemical bonding and shapes of compounds, main group elements (s and p blocks), transition metals (d block), analytical chemistry

documents: Original mark sheet of qualifying exam
Certificate of qualifying exam in original

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
IISER Aptitude Test 2024 - IISER has concluded the IISER IAT admission 2024. The authority released the IISER IAT 2024 seat allotment for round 8 on September 6, 2024. The IISER IAT seat allotment link was available on the official website iiseradmission.in. The last date to accept the IISER 2024 seats was September 8, 2024. Candidates who qualified the IISER aptitude test had to participate in the IISER IAT 2024 counselling for admissions. The authority has published the IISER IAT cutoff for all the rounds on the official website. 

The seat allotment for IISER IAT 2024 counselling rounds 1, 2, 3. 4, 5, 6 and 7 were released on July 18, 30, August 7, 14, 20 & 26, September 6, 2024. The certificate verification for counselling was held from July 2 to 6. The authority conducted the IISER IAT counselling registration from June 25 to July 1, 2024. The authority declared the IISER result 2024 on June 25 on the official website. IISER 2024 final answer key for IISER 2024 was released on June 21, 2024. The objection window for IISER 2024 answer key was open from June 12 to 14, 2024. The provisional IISER IAT answer key was released on June 9. IISER Aptitude Test 2024 was conducted on June 9. Candidates were able to download the IISER admit card 2024 from June 1 to 9.

The authority activated the IAT 2024 mock test on May 26 online. Candidates can access the mock test for IAT 2024 at iiseradmission.in.  The authority has concluded the IISER  Aptitude Test 2024 registration process on May 13. The authority conducted the IISER Aptitude test application form correction from May 16 to 17. 

The IISER aptitude test 2024 is conducted for admission to BS-MS (Dual Degree) and four-year BS degree programs. Prospective candidates seeking admission to the IISERs including, IISER Berhampur, IISER Bhopal, IISER Kolkata, IISER Mohali, IISER Pune, IISER Thiruvananthapuram, and IISER Tirupati, are encouraged to register for the IISER Aptitude Test (IAT 2024) by visiting the official website - iiseradmission.in.

Applicants with Indian citizenship, Persons of Indian Origin (PIO), Overseas Citizens of India (OCI), and Foreign Nationals are eligible to apply for the IAT 2024. Examination centres and other details related to the IISER Aptitude Test are available on the website.

Candidates are advised to carefully check the eligibility criteria of the IISER admission test 2024 before proceeding with the application process. According to the IISER 2024 eligibility criteria, only IAT 2024 scores will be considered for admissions to IISERs. Applicants must have passed three subjects Biology, Chemistry, Mathematics, and Physics. Those who have passed the Class 12 or equivalent examination in the science stream in 2022, 2023, or 2024, with a minimum of 60% marks (general candidates), are eligible to apply for IAT 2024. For candidates belonging to Scheduled Caste (SC), Scheduled Tribe (ST), and Person with Disability (PwD) categories, the minimum score requirement is 55% to apply for IAT 2024. The application process for the IISER 2024 entrance exam consists of registration, filling out the application form, uploading documents, and payment of fees.

IISER Aptitude Test Latest News and Updates 2024

  • IISER IAT seat allotment for round 8 released.
  • IISER IAT 2024 seat allotment for round 7 declared.

  • IISER IAT 2024 round 6 seat allotment announced.

  • IISER IAT 2024 seat allotment for round 5 declared.

  • IISER IAT 2024 round 4 counselling/admission offers released.

  • IISER IAT 2024 seat allotment for round 3 declared.

  • IISER IAT 2024 seat allotment for round 2 announced.

  • IISER first round counselling/admission process dates released.

  • IISER IAT 2024 result has been announced.

  • IISER final answer key released.

  • The objection window for IISAT 2024 closed on June 14, 2024

  • IAT object form released.

  • The authority has released the IAT 2024 answer key on June 9, 2024.

  • The authority conducted the IAT 2024 exam on June 9, 2024.

  • The authority has issued the IAT 2024 admit card on June 1, 2024.

  • The authority has activated the IAT 2024 mock test online

  • The authority conducted the IISER Aptitude test application form correction from May 16 to 17.

  • The authority concluded the IISER 2024 registration process on May 13.

  • The authority has commenced the IISER 2024 registration process on April 1, 2024.

  • The authority has announced the IISER 2024 exam date on the official website.

  • The authorities has released the official notification of IISER 2024 admission test on the official website. 

About IISER Aptitude Test

The Indian Institutes of Science Education and Research conducts the IISER aptitude test 2024, as a computer-based test (CBT) for admission to B.E/B.tech courses as a 3-hour multiple-choice paper having 60 questions. There are seven participating institutes taking admission through IISER.

The authorities have released the admit card of IISER 2024 for those candidates who will fill out the application form before the deadline in online mode. Candidates are advised to carry their IISER aptitude test admit card 2024 along with one valid photo ID proof at the exam centre.

The authorities have released the IISER aptitude test answer key 2024 online mode for candidates who will appear for the examination. Candidates can check the correct responses to the questions asked in the entrance test with the help of the answer key of IISER aptitude test 2024.

application_process.html_content:
Indian Institute of Science Education and Research has concluded the IISER 2024 application form in online mode. The aspirants interested to fill the application form of IISER 2024 had to fill the application form. The IISER 2024 application process  comprises registration, filling application form, uploading documents and payment of fee. The application of IISER aptitude test has been released separately for KVPY, IAT and JEE(Advanced) channels. 

How to fill IISER application form 2024?

  • Registration: Candidates need to register themselves on the official website of IISERs to start the application process. They need to provide their basic details such as name, email ID, date of birth, category and phone number to register. Once the IISER aptitude test registration is complete, candidates will receive user ID to their registered email ID and mobile number.
  • Filling the application form: After registration, candidates need to fill the application form by providing their personal and academic details, educational qualifications, etc. 
  • Uploading documents: Candidates have to upload the documents in the IISER application form 2024 as per the specifications. The documents and their specification is provided below.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Preparing for the IISER Aptitude Test 2024 requires a well-planned strategy that includes effective study materials, practice tests, and time management. By following these tips, candidates can prepare effectively for the IISER Aptitude Test 2024 and increase their chances of success in the exam. Here are some tips that can help you prepare for the IISER Aptitude Test 2024:

  1. Understand the exam pattern and syllabus: The IISER Aptitude Test 2024 will consist of multiple-choice questions from the subjects of Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, and Biology. Candidates should carefully go through the exam pattern and syllabus to understand the topics and subtopics that are important for the exam.

  2. Collect study materials: Candidates can refer to textbooks, reference books, and online resources to collect study materials for the exam. They should also try to solve previous year question papers and sample papers to get an idea of the type of questions that can be asked in the exam.

  3. Make a study plan: Candidates should make a study plan that includes a daily schedule for studying different subjects. They should allocate more time to the subjects they are weak in and revise the topics they have already studied regularly.

  4. Time management: Time management is an important factor while preparing for the IISER Aptitude Test 2024. Candidates should practice solving questions within the given time limit to improve their speed and accuracy.

  5. Practice Mock Test: Candidates are advised to solve the Mock test of IISER to understand what type of questions are asked. Solving previous year question paper will help candidates to understand the exam pattern and ultimately to score good marks in exam.

  6. Stay healthy: Lastly, candidates should take care of their physical and mental health by eating healthy, staying hydrated, and taking breaks between study sessions. Regular exercise and sufficient sleep can also help them stay focused and motivated.

admit_card.html_content:
The IISER Aptitude Test 2024 admit card has been released on June 1, 2024. To download the admit card 2024 candidates will have to use their login ID and password. On the admit card of IISER aptitude test 2024 candidates can check personal details, exam date, exam time, exam day guidelines and more. Candidates applying through the IAT channel will have to carry their IISER 2024 admit card to the examination centre with one valid photo ID proof. Candidates are advised to carefully check the details mentioned in the IISER hall ticket and contact the authorities in case of any discrepancy. Here are the steps that candidates need to follow to download their IISER Aptitude Test 2024 admit card:

How to download the IISER admit card 2024?

  • Visit the IISER official website - iiseradmission.in.

  • Click on the direct link to download IISER admit card 2024.

  • Enter the login credentials namely User ID and password in the required fields.

  • Check all the details mentioned in the admit card of IISER 2024.

  • The IISER Aptitude Test 2024 admit card will be displayed on the screen.

  • Download and take a printout of the admit card for future reference.

Documents Required at Exam

  • IISER admit card 2024

counselling_process.html_content:
IISER has concluded the IISER IAT 2024 admission process. The authority conducted 8 rounds of IISER counselling. Candidates can check the seat allotment of IISER 2024 from the official website. The authority released the IISER counselling dates 2024 on the official website. Candidates who qualified the IISER aptitude test were eligible to participate in the counselling process. Candidates must note that the IISER counselling 2024 will be conducted separately for all three channels namely KVPY, IAT and JEE(Advanced) channels. 

After the results are declared, candidates who have qualified for the IISER Aptitude Test had to register for the counselling process. The IISER 2024 counselling registration was held online from June 25 to July 1 on the official website. After registration, candidates had to fill in their choice of programs and institutions for admission. Based on the merit list, choices filled by the candidates, and availability of seats, the seats are allotted to the candidates. Candidates who are allotted seats need to confirm their acceptance of the seat by paying the requisite fee. After that the candidates who have confirmed their acceptance of the seat need to report to the allotted institution within the stipulated time to complete the admission process.

The authorities has released the IISER 2024 exam pattern along with the official notification. Candidates are advised to check the exam pattern of IISER aptitude test before starting exam preparation. The exam pattern of IISER aptitude test 2024 comprises marking scheme, type of questions, maximum marks and others. 

IISER Exam Pattern 2024

Particulars

Details

Mode of exam

Computer Based Test (CBT)

Exam duration

3 hours

Total Marks

240

multiple-choice questions (MCQs)

(15 questions each from Biology, Chemistry, Mathematics, and Physics)

faqs.question: What are the documents required for admission to IISERs?
faqs.answer: The documents required for admission to IISERs include the admit card and scorecard of the IISER Aptitude Test, 10+2 or equivalent mark sheet, caste certificate (if applicable), and other relevant certificates.

faqs.question: What is the selection process for admission to IISERs?
faqs.answer: The selection process for admission to IISERs involves qualifying the IISER Aptitude Test followed by counselling and seat allotment.

faqs.question: What is the IISER Aptitude Test marking scheme?
faqs.answer: The IISER Aptitude Test is a multiple-choice question-based exam. Candidates are awarded 4 marks for every correct answer and 1 mark is deducted for every wrong answer.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the IISER Aptitude Test?
faqs.answer: The duration of the IISER Aptitude Test is 3 hours.

faqs.question: What is the syllabus for the IISER Aptitude Test?
faqs.answer: The IISER Aptitude Test syllabus includes topics from Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, and Biology of the 10+2 level.

faqs.question: What is the mode of the IISER Aptitude Test?
faqs.answer: The IISER Aptitude Test is conducted in online mode (Computer-Based Test).

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the IISER Aptitude Test?
faqs.answer: N/A

faqs.question: What is the IISER Aptitude Test?
faqs.answer: The IISER Aptitude Test is a national-level entrance exam conducted by the Indian Institutes of Science Education and Research (IISERs) for admission to their undergraduate course of engineering Sciences (Chemical Engineering, Data Science & Engineering, Electrical Engineering & Computer Science).

exam_name: HITSEEE - Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science Engineering Entrance Examination
conducting_body: Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
HITSEEE 2024 - The Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science (HITS) will declare the HITSEEE 2024 result on May 13. The authorities will release the HITSEEE results as a rank list on the website, hindustanuniv.ac.in. Candidates have to provide their email ID and password to check the HITSEEE result 2024. The HITS engineering entrance exam was conducted in multiple slots from May 3 to 10. The authorities conducted the HITSEEE exam for admissions to various undergraduate engineering programmes.

As per the HITSEEE 2024 exam pattern, the test will include 120 MCQs to be completed within 2 hours. The syllabus for the exam includes topics from the 10+2 level in Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, and English. The authorities will release the answer key after the completion of the exam. Based on the performance of the candidates, a merit list will be prepared, and candidates will be called for counselling and the seat allocation process. The HITSEEE 2024 counselling will be held from May 22 to May 29, 2024. 

Candidates who submitted the HITSEEE 2024 application form before the deadline can appear for HITSEEE 2024. The last date to submit the HITSEEE application form was April 29, 2024. Candidates had to choose their preferred slot and time for the HITSEEE exam while filling the HITSEEE 2024 application form. The authorities released the application form of HITSEEE 2024 on the official website on December 16. Candidates had to fill in their personal and academic details, upload relevant documents, and pay the application fee to register for HITSEEE 2024. The authorities have updated the HITSEEE 2024 eligibility criteria on the official website. HITSEEE 2024 is a computer-based entrance examination conducted by the Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science (HITS), located in Chennai.

About HITSEEE 

Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science conducts the HITSEEE exam for admission to various undergraduate engineering and architecture programmes. The Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science Engineering Entrance Exam (HITSEEE) is a university-level entrance exam. Candidates can check the HITSEEE 2024 fee structure to understand the segregation of fees of the institute. 

Applicants who successfully submit the application form will be able to download the HITSEEE 2024 admit card. The admit card of HITSEEE consists of the candidate's details along with the exam centre details. 

The HITSEEE result will be declared as a rank list on the official website. The result of HITSEEE will consist of the candidate's details, marks scored, rank obtained and more. Further, the authorities will release the HITSEEE cutoff 2024 along with the declaration of results. Candidates must meet the cutoff of HITSEEE to be eligible for admission. Candidates qualifying the cutoff will be called for HITSEEE counselling. The authorities will conduct the seat allotment based on the number of seats available and the total number of candidates who applied for the course. 

Students Helpline

Contact detail: 18004254438

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
HITSEEE aspirants must check the HITSEEE 2024 eligibility criteria released by the authorities. Candidates who fail to meet the eligibility criteria will be unable to participate in the HITSEEE 2024 admission process. The eligibility criteria of HITSEEE 2024 include parameters concerning age criteria, qualifying marks, examination etc.

Particulars

Details

Qualifying examination

Candidates must have passed 10+2/HSC/Intermediate or any equivalent examination with Maths and Physics as compulsory subjects and at least one of Chemistry / Biology / Computer Science / Information Technology / Informatics Practices / Engineering Graphics as major subjects in regular stream from any board.

Qualifying marks

An average of 50% marks aggregate.

Age criteria

Candidates whose date of birth falls on or after July 1, 2004, are eligible to apply for HITSEEE 2024.

NationalityOnly Indian nationals, residing in India can apply for HITSEEE 2024.

application_process.html_content:
The authorities concluded the HITSEEE 2024 application process on the official website on April 29. Candidates aiming to appear for HITSEEE 2024 had to complete the HITSEEE registration before the deadline. Applicants were required to follow specific steps for HITSEEE 2024 registration.


Steps to Fill HITSEEE 2024 Application Form

Step-1: Register- Candidates have to enter a valid email address and active mobile number to get themselves registered for HITSEEE 2024. 

Step-2: Verify Email- The next step is to verify the Email address through a one-time password for verification purposes. 

Step-3: Fill Online Application Form- Enter the required personal details, academic details, and more to complete the application form. 

Step-4: Upload Required Documents- After submitting all the required details, candidates have to upload scanned images of photographs and signatures in the prescribed format. 

Step-5: Pay Application Fees- Candidates have to pay the application fee in online mode (net banking, Credit/debit card).

Candidates must follow the below mentioned preparation tips of HITSEEE 2024 to ace the examination with flying colours.

  • Check the exam pattern and syllabus of HITSEEE 2024 in detail to not miss any important particulars.

  • Make a study time table to distribute an equal amount of weightage to each topic based on their weightage. 

  • Take help from experts or the internet to know the best study material for the HITSEEE exam. 

  • Make a habit of creating short notes while studying. Short notes are highly beneficial during examination days for quick revision. 

  • Practice mock tests/sample papers and previous year question papers to know the preparation level of HITSEEE. 

  • Do not study any new topic during the last days before the examination. Keep revising topics that are already studied.

admit_card.html_content:
HITSEEE admit card 2024 has been released in online mode on the official website. The admit card of HITSEEE 2024 has been issued to only those candidates who submit the application form before the last date. The HITSEEE admit card will consist of the name of the candidate, test centre details, exam details, general instructions for the exam, etc. No candidate will be allowed inside the exam centre without the HITSEEE hall ticket. Mentioned below are the steps to download the HITSEEE 2024 admit card:

How to Download HITSEEE 2024 Admit Card:

  • Visit the applicant login page and log in using user id and password.

  • Click on the 'download' tab.

  • The HITSEEE 2024 admit card will be available for download in PDF format.

  • Go through the details mentioned on it and take a printout of it.

cutoffs.html_content: The cutoff for HITSEEE 2024 will be released by the Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science (HITS) after the declaration of the result. The cutoff is the minimum score or rank required by the candidate to be eligible for admission to the various undergraduate engineering programs offered by HITS. The HITSEEE cutoff will depend on factors like the number of seats available, the exam difficulty level and the number of candidates appearing for the exam. Candidates who meet the HITSEEE 2024 cutoff criteria will be called for counselling and the seat allotment process. The cutoff will be released on the official website of HITS.

counselling_process.html_content:
The HITSEEE 2024 counselling process will be conducted by the Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science (HITS) for candidates who qualify for the entrance exam. The counselling process will be conducted from May 22 to May 29. Candidates who qualify for HITSEEE 2024 will be called for counselling based on their rank and the availability of seats. Applicants will be required to fill in their choices of courses and colleges in order of preference. Based on the availability of seats and the candidate's rank, the seats will be allotted to the students.

Candidates who are allotted seats during the HITSEEE 2024 counselling process will have to pay the admission fee and complete the formalities within a given time period. Students need to carry all the necessary documents, originals and their photocopies during counselling. Candidates who are unable to attend the first round of counselling can participate in subsequent rounds based on the availability of seats. The details of the HITSEEE 2024 counselling process will be available on the official website of HITS.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The exam pattern of HITSEEE consists of the marking scheme, subjects asked, question type,  time duration and more. Candidates appearing for the HITS 2024 entrance exam can check the exam pattern from below table.

HITSEEE 2024 Exam Pattern

Mode of Exam

Computer-based test

Language

English

Duration

2 hours

Type of questions

Multiple choice questions (MCQs)

Total number of questions

120 questions 

Marking Scheme

Every correct response will get 1 mark


Negative Marking

There will be no negative marking.

Tie-breaker rule

Candidates who will have the least negative responses will be considered.

conducting_body: Bihar Combined Entrance Competitive Examination Board

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
DCECE 2024 - BCECEB released the DCECE PE 2024 seat allotment result for the mop-up round on October 4, 2024. The authority has updated the DCECE seat allotment link on the official website bcece.bihar.gov.in. To check the seat allotment result for DCECE counselling, candidates require their roll number and password. Students can download their seat allotment letter by October 6. The last date to complete the document verification and admission process for DCECE counselling 2024 is October 6, 2024. Candidates who registered for the DCECE counselling have been considered for the seat allotment. The DCECE 2024 seat allotment is based on the candidate's merit, availability of seats and the number of applicants.  The Bihar Combined Entrance Competitive Examination conducts the DCECE counselling 2024 for admission into the state's participating institutes.

The authority declared the DCECE 2024 seat allotment result for round 2 on August 14, 2024. The link to check the DCECE seat allotment 2024 has been updated on the official website bcece.bihar.gov.in. The authority released the DCECE 2024 seat allotment for round 1 on August 5. The authority conducted the registration and choice-filling process of DCECE counselling 2024 from July 24 to 30. The authority has released the DCECE 2024 seat matrix online. Candidates can check the DCECE seat matrix to know the category-wise and course-wise seats available at each participating institute.

The DCECE 2024 counselling schedule along with the official notification is available on the official website bcece.bihar.gov.in. The authority released the DCECE 2024 results on July 14, 2024. The link to download the DCECE result 2024 was updated on the official website. Candidates had to use their roll number and date of birth to download the DCECE 2024 rank card. The DCECE 2024 exam was held on June 22 and 23, 2024.

Candidates had to carry the DCECE exam 2024 admit card to the exam centre. The DCECE admit card 2024 has been issued on June 13. The authority concluded the DCECE 2024 application form correction process on May 26, 2024. Only registered candidates were able to access the Bihar DCECE application correction 2024 facility from May 24 to 26, 2024. Bihar exam conducting body commenced the DCECE 2024 application form process on April 12, 2024, and closed the process on May 21, 2024. Candidates can check the important dates for DCECE 2024 here.

Before registering for the DCECE 2024 exam, hopeful candidates had to carefully assess the DCECE 2024 eligibility criteria, as failing to meet the minimum requirements will render them ineligible for the final allotment process. Candidates who have passed the class X exam conducted by the Bihar board or any other equivalent exam with a minimum of 35% were eligible to apply for the DCECE exam. 

The board has released the eligibility criteria for the Bihar Polytechnic exam 2024 along with the brochure. Students planning to appear for the DCECE exam 2024 are advised to check the syllabus and exam pattern before commencing their preparation.

DCECE 2024 Latest News and Updates

  • DCECE 2024 provisional seat allotment for the mop-up round released.
  • Dates for DCECE 2024 mop-up round counselling revised.
  • DCECE 2024 round 2 seat allotment released.
  • Round 1 seat allotment for DCECE 2024 announced.
  • Registration and choice-filling for DCECE 2024 concluded.
  • DCECE 2024 counselling registration and choice-filling commenced.
  • BCECEB has released the DCECE 2024 counselling notification and schedule online.
  • DCECE seat matrix 2024 released.
  • DCECE 2024 result declared.
  • The authority concluded the DCECE 2024 exam. 
  • DCECE exam 2024 commenced.
  • DCECE has issued the DCECE admit card on June 13, 2024.
  • The authority closed the form correction for DCECE 2024 on May 27.
  • DCECE has commenced the DCECE 2024 application form correction process started.
  • The last date for DCECE application fee payment is May 22, 2024.
  • BCECEB has extended the registration last date to May 21.
  • The DCECE admit card release date is June 13, 2024.
  • DCECE has released the DCECE 2024 application form on April 12, 2024.
  • DCECE has released the DCECE 2024 exam notification.

About DCECE 2024

Admission to diploma engineering courses at polytechnic institutes in the state of Bihar is done through the DCECE or Polytechnic Engineering (PE) paper. Students should note that apart from admission to three-year engineering diploma courses, DCECE 2024 will also be held for admission to the following programmes.

  • Para-medical  (PM) (intermediate level) 

  • Para-medical dental (PMD) (matric level)

  • Part-time 4-year Polytechnic Engineering (PPE)

DCECE 2024 is conducted as a pen-paper-based test for 2 hours and 15 minutes duration. The DCECE 2024 question paper includes 90 objective-type questions from physics, chemistry, and mathematics.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The Board released the eligibility criteria of DCECE 2024 along with the brochure. The DCECE 2024 eligibility criteria include various conditions and requirements that students will have to meet to get admission. The DCECE eligibility criteria include parameters like qualifying exam passed, minimum marks, and also age limit for appearing in the exam, as have been discussed below.

DCECE 2024 Eligibility Criteria 

Qualifying Exam – Candidates who have passed the Class X exam conducted by the Bihar Board or any other equivalent exam are eligible to apply. In addition, candidates appearing in the qualifying exam in 2024 can also apply on a provisional basis.

Minimum marks – The candidates need to have scored a minimum of 35% marks in Class X.

Age limit – Candidates of all ages can apply, as no age limit has been set.

Domicile – Indian citizens who meet the following conditions may apply. The parent of the candidate:

  • Is a permanent resident of Bihar

  • Enjoys refugee status in the state

  • Is employed with the Bihar government

  • Is employed with the central government in Bihar

  • Works with the UN and is currently posted in the state

Medical fitness – All candidates must be medically fit.

application_process.html_content:
The authority concluded the DCECE 2024 registration process on the official website. The Candidates are allowed to fill the application form for DCECE in online mode. Students could apply for the Bihar Polytechnic exam 2024 from the official website. Before proceeding to fill the DCECE form 2024, students are recommended to check the eligibility criteria carefully. The DCECE 2024 application form correction dates has been announce on official website.

DCECE 2024 Registration - Login window

DCECE Registration 2024 - Things to keep ready 

  • Valid email id and mobile number

  • Scanned/soft copy of passport size photograph (Less than 100 KB)

  • Scanned/soft copy of signature (Less than 100 KB)

  • Aadhar card 

  • Bank details 

DCECE Application Form 2024 - Steps to apply

  • Registration – To start the registration process, the candidate will have to first select the course group (PE in this case) and then enter valid email id and mobile number. Other details the candidate will be prompted to enter include name, DOB, Aadhaar number, etc. If the registration is successful, the activation code will be generated and sent to the registered email if and the mobile number of the candidate.

  • Filling of personal information - The candidate has to next fill the application form, which has sections like personal and communication details. In the personal details section, name, gender, DOB, the name of parents, etc. has to be entered. Academic section, meanwhile, fields like qualifying exam, marks, the name of the passing institute, etc.

  • Uploading of documents - In this stage, scanned images of photograph and signature need to be uploaded as per the specifications specified by the authorities. 

  • Filling of education information -  After paying the fee, enter details related to exam passed, subjects studied in the qualifying exam, the name of the school (college), board, passing status, year of passing, pass percentage, and percentage.

  • Preview DCECE application form– At this stage, the candidates will be able to preview the complete application form. Corrections will also be allowed at this stage. If the candidate is happy with details entered, he/she may submit the form.

  • Application fee payment– The application fee is Rs. 750 for open, and Rs. 480 for reserved (SC, ST and PwD) candidates. Both online (net banking, credit and debit cards ) and offline payment modes are available. To pay offline, e-challan has to be generated at the time of filling the application form. The challan can be used for making the payment at any nearby bank.

  • Take a printout of the form – Finally, download and take a printout of the application form.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Students who wish to get admission into the diploma engineering courses offered by the institutes in Bihar are required to apply and qualify the DCECE exam. Students can below check some of the preparation tips for DCECE exam 2024. 

  • Aspirants are advised to start their preparation with NCERT books. The DCECE syllabus 2024 is divided into Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics, mostly out of class 11 and 12 curriculum. However, students also prefer other recommended books after completion of NCERT. 

  • Next, aspirants should not forget to go through the detailed syllabus and exam pattern provided by the authorities. This will help them strategize better, 

  • Students should also make a timetable to ensure completion of syllabus before the entrance exam. 

  • Solving mock test and sample papers is also an important task to prepare better.

admit_card.html_content:
BCECEB released the DCECE 2024 admit card on June 13, 2024. Candidates can download the admit card for DCECE 2024 from bceceboard.bihar.gov.in. The login credentials required to download the DCECE admit card 2024 is registration number and date of birth. 

DCECE admit card is an important document required to appear in the exam and for completing subsequent admission formalities, the admit card will contain details like name and address of the exam centre, date and time of the exam, and also roll number of the candidate. 

Steps to download DCECE 2024 admit card

  • Visit the Bihar Polytechnic official website - bceceboard.bihar.gov.in.

  • Click on the admit card of the DCECE link.

  • Log in using your registration number and date of birth.

  • On successful login, a DCECE admit card will be displayed on the screen.

  • Download the DCECE admit card and take a printout.

counselling_process.html_content:
BCECEB announced the DCECE 2024 seat allotment result for the mop-up round on October 3 on the official website. The document verification & admission will conclude on October 6, 2024. The authority has released the revised round 1 seat allotment for DCECE 2024 on August 25, 2024. The revised seat allotment letters can be downloaded from September 3 to 4, 2024. Candidates allotted seats have to download the allotment order and report to the allotted institutes with the required document.

The authority has announced the DCECE 2024 seat allotment result for round 2 on August 14, 2024. The authority held the DCECE counselling 2024 registration between July 24 to 30, 2024 on the official website. Candidates had to complete the registration and choice filling to participate in the DCECE counselling process. The authority announced the DCECE round 1 seat allotment on August 5, 2024. 

DCECE 2024 Counselling Procedure

Online registration – Qualified candidates have to get registered by selecting the course, and then by entering the registration number, name, date of birth, security code, etc. Please note some details the candidate entered at the time of filling the application form will appear in read-only mode, and the candidate will also have to enter a few additional details.

Choice filling and locking –  After successful registration, the candidate has to next enter choices from the available options in the order of preference. The choices entered also have to be locked, or last entered choices would automatically get locked once the choice filling deadline expires. 

Seat Allotment – The second seat allotment is done online and based on merit; additionally, the category of choices entered by the candidate is taken into account. Allotted candidates have to report at Reporting Centres (RCs) in person on the scheduled date and time to accept the allotted seat. 

Payment of admission fee – Finally, the candidate has to pay the admission fee of Rs. 1000, to confirm the seat.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
Candidates appearing in the DCECE exam 2024 are advised to check the Bihar Polytechnic exam pattern beforehand. The exam pattern of DCECE 2024 helps them gain insights into the structure of the exam. Details such as the number and types of questions asked, exam duration, subjects covered, and much more are made available through the DCECE exam pattern 2024. Check the key components related to the DCECE exam pattern from below.

DCECE 2024 Exam pattern

  • The mode of the DCECE exam will be offline (pen-and-paper) based.

  • There will be one paper of 2 hours 15 minute duration

  • Question type will be Multiple Choice

  • Questions will be asked from physics, chemistry and mathematics.

  • Marking scheme - for each correct answer 5 marks will be awarded.

  • Questions will be set in English and Hindi languages

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
AP ECET 2024 - APSCHE has announced the AP ECET 2024 final phase seat allotment on August 8, 2024. The authority has updated the link to check the AP ECET seat allotment 2024 on the website ecet-sche.apt online.in/ECET. The authority concluded the AP ECET 2024 counselling for the final phase on August 4, 2024. Only the AP ECET-qualified candidates will be eligible for the AP ECET 2024 counselling registration.

The authority concluded the self-reporting process for AP ECET 2024 qualified candidates on July 15. Students who were allotted seats had to physically present the required documents along with the allotment order for successful admission. The AP Diploma classes have begun on July 10, 2024. The authority declared the AP ECET 2024 seat allotment result on July 9, 2024. To check the AP ECET seat allotment, candidates require their hall ticket number and date of birth. Registered candidates had to upload documents for verification from June 27 to June 3, 2024. AP ECET 2024 counselling registration portal was active from June 26 to 30.

highlights.value: Andhra Pradesh Engineering Common Entrance Test

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
JNTUA released the AP ECET 2024 eligibility criteria along with official notification. Applicants filling out the application form must check the eligibility criteria of AP ECET. In case any candidate fails to prove the eligibility criteria at the time of admission, his/her candidature will be cancelled. AP ECET eligibility criteria comprise nationality, domicile, academic qualification, marks required and others. For more details about AP ECET eligibility criteria 2024, candidates can check the details below.

Nationality
Candidates should be of Indian nationality

Domicile
Should belong to the state of Andhra Pradesh. and satisfy the local/non-local status requirements as laid down in the Andhra Pradesh Educational Institutions.

Academic Specifications
The candidates should have a qualified Diploma in Engineering and Technology from the State Board of Technical Education of Andhra Pradesh State or any other Diploma from an AICTE approved institution recognized by the Government of Andhra Pradesh.

OR

Should have qualified the 3-year B.Sc Degree exam with Mathematics as one of the subjects from a recognized University.

Those candidates who have not completed but will complete their Diploma before admission will also be able to apply for AP ECET 2024.

Marks Required
To be eligible for admissions, the candidates should have passed the Diploma in Engineering and Technology with a minimum of 45% marks (for the reserved category it is 40% marks).

application_process.html_content:
The AP ECET 2024 application form submission was concluded with late a fee on May 2, 2024. Candidates who meet the minimum eligibility conditions could fill out the AP ECET application form 2024. The application process comprised registration, form filling, uploading documents, and payment of the ECET registration fee. Candidates must complete the AP ECET registration 2024 before the last date. The authority concluded the AP ECET 2024 application form correction process. The correction facility was available from April 25 to 27, 2024. Steps to fill out the AP ECET application form 2024 are given below.

How to fill AP ECET application form 2024

Step 1 - Payment of Fee:
The first step is to complete the AP ECET application fee payment and fill basic details in online mode. Applicants will be able to pay the ECET 2024 application fee through credit card/debit card/net banking.  Candidates will also be able to pay the AP ECET application fee in offline mode at AP Online/ TS Online centres. 

Step 2 - Filling application form:
The next step is to fill details in the application form of AP ECET 2024. Applicants have to fill in details like personal details, category, qualifying examination, academic information and others. Candidates are also required to fill out the AP ECET exam centre choices in the application form. 

Step 3 - Uploading Documents
After filling all the details in the application form, applicants have to upload scanned images of photographs and signatures in the AP ECET application form. 

Step 4 - Preview and Submit Application Form
The final step is to check all the filled details in the AP ECET 2024 application form and submit the form.

AP ECET 2024 Application Correction 
The exam conducting authority opened the ECET correction window 2024 at the official website after the conclusion of the application process. Applicants can edit certain details through the application correction facility of ECET.

admit_card.html_content:
The exam authorities released the AP ECET 2024 admit card on the official website. Applicants who fill out the application form before the last date can access the AP ECET admit card 2024. Candidates have to provide the registration number, qualifying hall ticket number, and date of birth to download the ECET hall ticket. The admit card will comprise candidates' details, exam date, exam centre venue, and important instructions. In case of any discrepancy in the AP ECET admit card, applicants must contact the exam authorities for corrections a few days before the exam. Candidates appearing for the exam had to carry a hard copy of the AP ECET 2024 admit card along with one valid ID proof at the exam centre. The steps to download the AP ECET admit card are given below.

How to download the AP ECET admit card 2024?

  • Visit the AP ECET official website.

  • Click on the direct link to download the admit card.

  • Enter the login credentials in the required fields - application number and date of birth.

  • Check all the details mentioned in the admit card.

  • Download the AP ECET hall ticket for future reference.

Details mentioned in the AP ECET 2024 admit card

  • Candidate’s name

  • Roll number

  • Candidate’s photograph

  • Candidate’s signature

  • Candidate’s registration number
