• Numerical solutions of linear and non-linear algebraic equations integration by trapezoidal and Simpson’s rule, single and multi-step methods for differential equations

• Laws of thermodynamics, activity, equilibrium constant, applications to metallurgical systems, solutions, phase equilibria, Ellingham and phase stability diagrams, thermodynamics of surfaces, interfaces and defects, adsorption and segregation
  • Basic kinetic laws, order of reactions, rate constants and rate limiting steps; principles of electro chemistry-single electrode potential, electrochemical cells and polarizations, aqueous corrosion and protection of metals
  • Oxidation and high temperature corrosion characterization and control; heat transfer conduction, convection and heat transfer coefficient relations, radiation, mass transfer diffusion and Fick’s laws, mass transfer coefficients
  • Momentum transfer concepts of viscosity, shell balances, Bernoulli’s equation, friction factors

• Minerals of economic importance, comminution techniques, size classification, flotation, gravity and other methods of mineral processing; agglomeration, pyro-hydro-and electro-metallurgical processes; material and energy balances
  • Principles and processes for the extraction of non-ferrous metals aluminium, copper, zinc, lead, magnesium, nickel, titanium and other rare metals; iron and steel making principles, role structure and properties of slags, metallurgical coke, blast furnace
  • Direct reduction processes, primary and secondary steel making, ladle metallurgy operations including deoxidation, desulphurization, sulphide shape control, inert gas rinsing and vacuum reactors
  • Secondary refining processes including AOD, VAD, VOD, VAR and ESR; ingot and continuous casting; stainless steel making, furnaces and refractories

• Crystal structure and bonding characteristics of metals, alloys, ceramics and polymers, structure of surfaces and interfaces, nano-crystalline and amorphous structures; solid solutions; solidification, phase transformation and binary phase diagrams
  • Principles of heat treatment of steels, cast iron and aluminum alloys; surface treatments; recovery, recrystallization and grain growth; industrially important ferrous and non-ferrous alloys; elements of X-ray and electron diffraction
  • Principles of scanning and transmission electron microscopy; industrial ceramics, polymers and composites; electronic basis of thermal, optical, electrical and magnetic properties of materials; electronic and opto-electronic materials

• Elasticity, yield criteria and plasticity; defects in crystals; elements of dislocation theory types of dislocations, slip and twinning, source and multiplication of dislocations, stress fields around dislocations, partial dislocations
  • Dislocation interactions and reactions; strengthening mechanisms; tensile, fatigue and creep behaviour; super-plasticity; fracture Griffith theory, basic concepts of linear elastic and elasto-plastic fracture mechanics, ductile to brittle transition
  • Fracture toughness; failure analysis; mechanical testing tension, compression, torsion, hardness, impact, creep, fatigue, fracture toughness and formability

• Metal casting patterns and moulds including mould design involving feeding, gating and risering, melting, casting practices in sand casting, permanent mould casting, investment casting and shell moulding, casting defects and repair
  • Hot, warm and cold working of metals, metal forming-fundamentals of metal forming processes of rolling, forging, extrusion, wire drawing and sheet metal forming, defects in forming; metal joining-soldering, brazing and welding
  • Metal joining-common welding processes of shielded metal arc welding, gas metal arc welding, gas tungsten arc welding and submerged arc welding; welding metallurgy, problems associated with welding of steels and aluminium alloys, defects in welded joints
  • Powder metallurgy; NDT using dye-penetrant, ultrasonic, radiography, eddy current, acoustic emission and magnetic particle methods
• Matrix algebra, systems of linear equations, eigenvalues and eigenvectors

• Functions of single variable, limit, continuity, and differentiability, mean value theorems, evaluation of definite and improper integrals, partial derivatives, total derivative, maxima and minima, gradient, divergence and curl
  • Vector identities, directional derivatives, line, surface and volume integrals, Stokes, Gauss and Green’s theorems

• First order equations (linear and nonlinear), higher order linear differential equations with constant coefficients, Cauchy’s and Euler’s equations, initial and boundary value problems, Laplace transforms
  • Solutions of one dimensional heat and wave equations and Laplace equation
• Analytic functions, Cauchy’s integral theorem, Taylor and Laurent series
• Definitions of probability and sampling theorems, conditional probability, mean, median, mode and standard deviation, random variables, poisson, normal and binomial distributions
• Numerical solutions of linear and non-linear algebraic equations integration by trapezoidal and Simpson’s rule, single and multi-step methods for differential equations

• Classification of textile fibres; essential requirements of fibre forming polymers; gross and fine structure of natural fibres like cotton, wool and silk
  • Introduction to important bast fibres; properties and uses of natural and man-made fibres
  • Molecular architecture, amorphous and crystalline phases, glass transition, plasticization, crystallization, melting, factors affecting Tg and Tm
  • Polymerization of nylon-6, nylon-66, poly (ethylene terephthalate), polyacrylonitrile and polypropylene; melt spinning processes, characteristic features of PET, polyamide and polypropylene spinning; wet and dry spinning of viscose and acrylic fibres
  • Post spinning operations such as drawing, heat setting, tow-to-top conversion and different texturing methods
  • Methods of investigating fibre structure e.g. density, X-ray diffraction, birefringence, optical and electron microscopy, I.R. absorption, thermal methods (DSC, DMA/TMA, TGA); structure and morphology of man-made fibres, mechanical properties of fibres
  • Moisture sorption in fibres; fibre structure and property correlation

units.syllabus_heading: Yarn manufacture and yarn structure and properties
units.topics_html:
• Principles of opening, cleaning and mixing/blending of fibrous materials, working principle of modern opening and cleaning equipments; the technology of carding, carding of cotton and synthetic fibres; drafting operation
  • Roller and apron drafting principle, causes of mass irregularity introduced by drafting; roller arrangements in drafting systems; principles of cotton combing, combing cycle, mechanism and function, combing efficiency, lap preparation
  • Recent developments in comber; roving production, mechanism of bobbin building, roving twist; Principle of ring spinning, forces acting on yarn and traveler; modification in ring and traveler designs; mechanism of cop formation, causes of end breakages
  • Working principle of ring doubler and two for one twister, single and folded yarn twist, properties of double yarns, production of core spun yarn, compact spinning, principle of non conventional methods of yarn production such as rotor spinning
  • Principle of non conventional methods of yarn production such as air jet spinning, wrap spinning, twistless spinning and friction spinning
  • Yarn contraction, yarn diameter, specific volume and packing coefficient; twist strength relationship in spun yarns; fibre configuration and orientation in yarn; cause of fibre migration and its estimation, irregularity index, properties of ring
  • Rotor and air-jet yarns

• Principles of cheese and cone winding processes and machines; random and precision winding; package faults and their remedies; yarn clearers and tensioners; different systems of yarn splicing; features of modern cone winding machines
  • Different types of warping creels; features of modern beam and sectional warping machines; different sizing systems, sizing of spun and filament yarns, modern sizing machines, different sizing ingredients; principles of pirn winding processes and machines
  • Primary and secondary motions of loom, effect of their settings and timings on fabric formation, fabric appearance and weaving performance; dobby and jacquard shedding; mechanics of weft insertion with shuttle; warp and weft stop motions, warp protection
  • Weft replenishment; functional principles of weft insertion systems of shuttleless weaving machines, principles of multiphase and circular looms

units.syllabus_heading: Principles of weft and warp knitting
units.topics_html:
• Basic weft and warp knitted structures
  • Basic woven fabric constructions and their derivatives; crepe, cord, terry, gauze, leno and double cloth constructions
  • Peirce's equations for fabric geometry; elastica model of plain woven fabrics; thickness, cover and maximum sett of woven fabrics

• Sampling techniques, sample size and sampling errors
  • Measurement of fibre length, fineness, crimp, strength and reflectance; measurement of cotton fibre maturity and trash content; HVI and AFIS for fibre testing
  • Measurement of yarn count, twist and hairiness; tensile testing of fibres, yarns and fabrics; evenness testing of slivers, rovings and yarns; testing equipment for measurement test methods of fabric properties like thickness, compressibility
  • Measurement test methods of fabric properties like air permeability, drape, crease recovery, tear strength, bursting strength and abrasion resistance
  • Statistical data analysis of experimental results
  • Correlation analysis, significance tests and analysis of variance; frequency distributions and control charts

• Chemistry and practice of preparatory processes for cotton
  • Mercerization of cotton
  • Preparatory processes for nylon, polyester and acrylic and polyester/ cotton blends

• Classification of dyes
  • Dyeing of cotton and polyester with appropriate dye classes
  • Dyeing polyester/ cotton blends
  • Batchwise and continuous dyeing machines
  • Dyeing of cotton knitted fabrics and machines used
  • Methods for determination of wash, light and rubbing fastness
  • Evaluation of fastness properties with the help of grey scale

• Styles of printing
  • Printing thickeners including synthetic thickeners
  • Printing auxiliaries
  • Printing of cotton with reactive dyes
  • Printing of polyester with disperse dyes
  • Methods of dye fixation after printing
  • Resist and discharge printing of cotton and polyester
  • Printing of polyester/ cotton blends with disperse/ reactive combination
  • Transfer printing of polyester
  • Developments in inkjet printing

• Mechanical finishing of cotton
  • Stiff
  • Soft, wrinkle resistant, water repellent, flame retardant and enzyme (bio-polishing) finishing of cotton
  • Milling, decatizing and shrink resistant finishing of wool
  • Antistat finishing of synthetic fibre fabrics
  • Heat setting of polyester
• Energy crisis, energy conservation in spinning, weaving, processing, humidification and lighting

• Treatment of textile effluents
  • Air pollution, water pollution, noise pollution, dust pollution, management of solid hazardous wastes, ISO-14001

  • Network security basic concepts of public key and private key cryptography, digital signature, firewalls
• HTML, XML, basic concepts of client-server computing

• Functions of single variable, limit, continuity, and differentiability, mean value theorems, evaluation of definite and improper integrals, partial derivatives, total derivative, maxima and minima, gradient, divergence and curl, vector identities
  • Directional derivatives, line, surface and volume integrals, Stokes, Gauss and Green’s theorems

• First order equations (linear and nonlinear), higher order linear differential equations with constant coefficients, Cauchy’s and Euler’s equations, initial and boundary value problems, Laplace transforms
  • Solutions of one dimensional heat and wave equations and Laplace equation
• Analytic functions, Cauchy’s integral theorem, Taylor and Laurent series
• Definitions of probability and sampling theorems, conditional probability, mean, median, mode and standard deviation, random variables, poisson, normal and binomial distributions
• Numerical solutions of linear and non-linear algebraic equations integration by trapezoidal and Simpson’s rule, single and multi-step methods for differential equations

• Carbohydrates: Structure and functional properties of mono-, oligo-, and polysaccharides including starch, cellulose, pectic substances and dietary fibre, gelatinization and retrogradation of starch
  • Proteins: Classification and structure of proteins in food, biochemical changes in post mortem and tenderization of muscles
  • Lipids: Classification and structure of lipids, rancidity, polymerization and polymorphism
  • Pigments: Carotenoids, chlorophylls, anthocyanins, tannins and myoglobin
  • Food flavours: Terpenes, esters, aldehydes, ketones and quinones
  • Enzymes: Specificity, simple and inhibition kinetics, coenzymes, enzymatic and non-enzymatic browning
  • Nutrition: Balanced diet, essential amino acids and essential fatty acids, protein efficiency ratio, water soluble and fat soluble vitamins, role of -15-minerals in nutrition, co-factors, anti-nutrients, nutraceuticals, nutrient deficiency diseases
  • Chemical and biochemical changes: Changes occur in foods during different processing

• Characteristics of microorganisms: Morphology of bacteria, yeast, mold and actinomycetes, spores and vegetative cells, gram-staining
  • Microbial growth: Growth and death kinetics, serial dilution technique
  • Food spoilage: Spoilage microorganisms in different food products including milk, fish, meat, egg, cereals and their products
  • Toxins from microbes: Pathogens and non-pathogens including staphylococcus, salmonella, shigella, escherichia, bacillus, clostridium, and aspergillus genera
  • Fermented foods and beverages: Curd, yoghurt, cheese, pickles, soya-sauce, sauerkraut, idli, dosa, vinegar, alcoholic beverages and sausage

• Processing principles: Thermal processing, chilling, freezing, dehydration, addition of preservatives and food additives, irradiation, fermentation, hurdle technology, intermediate moisture foods
  • Food packaging and storage: Packaging materials, aseptic packaging, controlled and modified atmosphere storage
  • Cereal processing and products: Milling of rice, wheat, and maize, parboiling of paddy, bread, biscuits, extruded products and ready to eat breakfast cereals
  • Oil processing: Expelling, solvent extraction, refining and hydrogenation
  • Fruits and vegetables processing: Extraction, clarification, concentration and packaging of fruit juice, jam, jelly, marmalade, squash, candies, tomato sauce, ketchup, and puree, potato chips, pickles
  • Plantation crops processing and products: Tea, coffee, cocoa, spice, extraction of essential oils and oleoresins from spices
  • Milk and milk products processing: Pasteurization and sterilization, cream, butter, ghee, ice-cream, cheese and milk powder
  • Processing of animal products: Drying, canning, and freezing of fish and meat; production of egg powder
  • Waste utilization: Pectin from fruit wastes, uses of by-products from rice milling
  • Food standards and quality maintenance: FPO, PFA, A-Mark, ISI, HACCP, food plant sanitation and cleaning in place (CIP)

• Mass and energy balance; momentum transfer: Flow rate and pressure drop relationships for Newtonian fluids flowing through pipe, Reynolds number
  • Heat transfer: Heat transfer by conduction, convection, radiation, heat exchangers
  • Mass transfer: Molecular diffusion and Fick's law, conduction and convective mass transfer, permeability through single and multilayer films
  • Mechanical operations: Size reduction of solids, high pressure homogenization, filtration, centrifugation, settling, sieving, mixing and agitation of liquid
  • Thermal operations: Thermal sterilization, evaporation of liquid foods, hot air drying of solids, spray and freeze-drying, freezing and crystallization
  • Mass transfer operations: Psychometric, humidification and dehumidification operations

• Pharmacognosy and phytochemistry chemistry, tests, isolation, characterization and estimation of phytopharmaceuticals belonging to the group of alkaloids, glycosides, terpenoids, steroids, bioflavonoids, purines, guggul lipids
  • Pharmacognosy of crude drugs that contain the above constituents
  • Standardization of raw materials and herbal products
  • WHO guidelines
  • Quantitative microscopy including modern techniques used for evaluation
  • Biotechnological principles and techniques for plant development, tissue culture

• General pharmacological principles including toxicology
  • Drug interaction
  • Pharmacology of drugs acting on central nervous system, cardiovascular system, autonomic nervous system, gastrointestinal system and respiratory system
  • Pharmacology of autocoids, hormones, hormone antagonists, chemotherapeutic agents including anticancer drugs
  • Bioassays, immunopharmacology
  • Drugs acting on the blood and blood forming organs
  • Drugs acting on the renal system

• Structure, nomenclature, classification, synthesis, SAR and metabolism of the following category of drugs, which are official in Indian pharmacopoeia and British pharmacopoeia
  • Introduction to drug design
  • Stereochemistry of drug molecules
  • Hypnotics and sedatives, analgesics, NSAIDS, neuroleptics, antidepressants, anxiolytics, anticonvulsants, antihistamines, local anaesthetics, cardiovascular drugs antianginal agents vasodilators, adrenergic and cholinergic drugs, cardiotonic agents
  • Diuretics, antihypertensive drugs, hypoglycemic agents, antilipemic agents, coagulants, anticoagulants, antiplatelet agents
  • Chemotherapeutic agents antibiotics, antibacterials, sulfa drugs. antiprotozoal drugs, antiviral, antitubercular, antimalarial, anticancer, antiamoebic drugs
  • Diagnostic agents
  • Preparation and storage and uses of official radio pharmaceuticals, vitamins and hormones
  • Eicosanoids and their application

• Development, manufacturing standards Q.C. limits, labeling, as per the pharmacopoeial requirements
  • Storage of different dosage forms and new drug delivery systems
  • Biopharmaceutics and pharmacokinetics and their importance in formulation
  • Formulation and preparation of cosmetics lipstick, shampoo, creams, nail preparations and dentifrices
  • Pharmaceutical calculations

• Drugs and cosmetics act and rules with respect to manufacture, sales and storage
  • Pharmacy act
  • Pharmaceutical ethics

• Principles, instrumentation and applications of the following: Absorption spectroscopy (UV, visible and IR)
  • Fluorimetry, flame photometry, potentiometry
  • Conductometry and polarography
  • Pharmacopoeial assays
  • Principles of NMR, ESR, mass spectroscopy
  • X-ray diffraction analysis and different chromatographic methods

• Biochemical role of hormones, vitamins, enzymes, nucleic acids, bioenergetics
  • General principles of immunology
  • Immunological
  • Metabolism of carbohydrate, lipids, proteins
  • Methods to determine, kidney and liver function
  • Lipid profiles

• Principles and methods of microbiological assays of the pharmacopoeia
  • Methods of preparation of official sera and vaccines
  • Serological and diagnostics tests
  • Applications of microorganisms in bio conversions and in pharmaceutical industry

• Therapeutic drug monitoring dosage regimen in pregnancy and lactation, pediatrics and geriatrics
  • Renal and hepatic impairment
  • Drug-drug interactions and drug-food interactions, adverse drug reactions
  • Medication history, interview and patient counseling

exam_name: AP POLYCET - Andhra Pradesh Polytechnic Common Entrance Test
conducting_body: State Board of Technical Education and Training Andhra Pradesh

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
AP POLYCET 2024 - DTE, Andhra Pradesh has declared the AP Polycet 2024 seat allotment for the final phase today, July 16. The link to check the AP POLYCET 2024 final phase seat allotment is active at appolycet.nic.in. The authority concluded the AP POLYCET 2024 document verification on July 13, 2024. After the document verification, candidates could fill in their AP POLYCET choices from July 11 to 14.  The authority commenced the APolycet counselling 2024 registration for the final phase on July 11, 2024. The registered candidates could complete the document verification for AP Polycet 2024 on the official website. 

The authority has announced the AP Polycet 2024 seat allotment result for round 1 on June 13, 2024. Candidates had to enter their choice of courses and institutes online from June 7 to 10, 2024. AP Polycet counselling registration portal was open from May 24 to June 2.

The authority announced the AP POLYCET 2024 results on May 8. The final AP POLYCET answer key 2024 was released on May 5 at apsbtet.ap.gov.in. Candidates could object to the final AP POLYCET answer key from April 30 to May 4. The Andhra Polytechnic entrance exam was held on April 27.

The authority issued the AP Polycet 2024 hall ticket on April 18. Andhra Polycet application form-filling process concluded on April 10. Candidates who have passed the SSC exam or an equivalent exam scoring a minimum of 35% marks in aggregate with Mathematics as a compulsory subject can apply for the AP POLYCET. SBTET, AP will update the AP Polycet 2024 exam dates online including the AP POLYCET 2024 counselling dates.

Candidates who wish to get admission to all Diploma courses offered at Engineering / Non-Engineering / Technology offered at Polytechnic colleges in Andhra Pradesh have to appear for AP Polytechnic CET. The authority will conduct the exam in offline (pen, and paper) mode. The AP POLYCET 2024 syllabus is based on the class X (SSC) syllabus topics from Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics.

About AP POLYCET 2024

The Andhra Pradesh Polytechnic exam is conducted for admission of candidates into diploma courses in engineering. Students who qualify the entrance exam are eligible for admission into the offered courses by the participating institutes.

highlights.value: Andhra Pradesh Polytechnic Common Entrance Test
State Board of Technical Education and Training Andhra Pradesh

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
SBTET released the AP Polycet 2024 eligibility criteria online at the official website. Candidates need to check the brochure to know the eligibility criteria of AP Polycet 2024. The eligibiltiy criteria are the conditions that candidates need to fulfil before applying for the test. AP Polycet eligibility criteria comprise nationality, domicile, age, and much more. The eligible candidates will have to fill out the application form before the AP Polycet last date. The important eligibility criteria that the candidate should meet have been explained in detail below.

Eligibility Criteria of AP POLYCET 2024

  • Nationality and domicile – The candidate needs to be an Indian national and a resident of Andhra Pradesh.

  • Qualifying Exam – The candidate must have passed the SSC examination conducted by the State Board of Secondary Education, Andhra Pradesh/ Telangana or an equivalent exam scoring a minimum of 35% marks in aggregate with Mathematics as a compulsory subject.

  • Age limit – There is no lower or upper age limit to appear in the exam.

application_process.html_content:
SBTET concluded the window for filling out the AP Polycet 2024 application form. The authority was updated the link for AP Polycet 2024 registration at, polycetap.nic.in. Moreover, the application form for AP Polycet 2024 was available in both online and offline mode. AP Polycet application process comprises of registration, form filling, uploading of documents, and payment of registration fees. Students can approach any of the nearest AP online /payment gateway/net banking/Helpline centres (Polytechnics). Candidates must check the eligibility criteria before filling out the AP Polycet application form 2024.

Steps in Application Submission

  • Fill details in the Application form
  • Upload Photo & Signature
  • Pay Application fee
  • Download Hall Ticket

How to fill AP POLYCET 2024 application form- Online

  • Visit the official website and fill the online application form based on detailed instructions.
  • Candidates need to upload the necessary documents as per the prescribed format.
  • Pay the application fee by Credit/Debit card.
  • Download hall ticket: Candidates will receive the hall ticket instantly as a PDF or through email after the successful completion of the fee payment.

How to fill AP POLYCET 2024 application form- Offline

  • The candidate has to first download the application form online take a printout and then proceed to fill out the hard copy of the application form. or The candidates can fill out the application form online mode itself. 

  • Details about a year of passing Class 10 hall ticket number, and date of birth have to be entered.

  • The name of the candidate should be the same as mentioned in school certificates. When entering the name, look to it that there is a gap between parts of the name. 

  • Fill in your father's name.

  • Fill in correspondence details. 

  • Mention the exam centre.

  • Category details (SC, ST, etc.) 

  • To be considered under CAP/SP/PH/NCC, pertaining details have to be mentioned.

  • Select the medium of the exam 

  • A photograph, duly signed by the parent (guardian), should be affixed in the designated space. 

Go to the nearby helpline centre and submit the application form to the computer operator there. At the time of submitting the application form, the candidate will also be required to pay the application fee of Rs. 400, either in cash or through net banking.

The computer operator feeds the details mentioned on the application form to a computer system and also upload essential documents like photograph and signature. After the process is over and the application form is successfully uploaded.

admit_card.html_content:
The authority has released the AP Polycet 2024 admit card online. The hall ticket of AP Polycet 2024 is available for the students who completed the registration process before the last date.  To download the AP Polycet hall ticket, candidates need to provide the login credentials. Candidates have to carry the AP Polycet admit card 2024 on the day of the exam.  

AP POLYCET Admit Card 2024 - Instructions 

  • Hall tickets issued to the candidate should be checked thoroughly. If a mistake is found, it should be corrected through the helpline centre immediately to get a revised Hall Ticket.

  • No candidate will be allowed with incorrect data and photo on the Hall ticket to appear for the examination.

  • Hall tickets is not transferable. Any tampering of the hall ticket will automatically lead to the disqualification of the Candidate.

  • Hall ticket is an important document and shall be preserved carefully after the examination till admission into Polytechnics is completed.

The process to download online AP POLYCET hall ticket 2024

  • Click on the hall ticket download link

  • A log-in panel will open. Log-in using – the Tenth Exam Hall ticket number, Date of Birth and year of passing/appearing in class 10

  • Click on the View and Print Hall Ticket button.

AP Polycet 2024 hall ticket- Offline Mode

Candidates can also obtain their AP Polycet hall ticket through helpline centres. The following steps can be referred to obtain the hall ticket in offline mode.

  • Download the application form from the official website and take a printout.

  • Fill all the required details of the application form paste the photograph and put signatures.

  • Visit the nearest helpline centre and submit the filled form to the computer operator.

  • The computer operator will enter all the details in the form of the online computer system and upload photographs and signatures of the candidate.

  • Pay an application fee of Rs 400 either through offline or online mode.

  • A print out of the application form will be taken by the computer operator and will be handed over to the candidate for checking all the details. Once the candidate verifies that all the details are correct, the operator will click on “Confirm” to finally submit the form.

  • Once the application form is submitted, the hall ticket of AP Polycet 2024 will be generated and given to the candidate.

It should be noted that the AP Polycet 2024 hall ticket will be generated on the same day but it may be possible that the hall ticket will take 2 to 3 days to generate due to the increase in a rush at the centres. So, the candidates are advised to get their hall tickets early to avoid such problems.

Details mentioned in AP Polycet 2024 Hall Ticket

The following details will be mentioned in the AP Polycet hall ticket-

  • Name of the candidate

  • Roll number of the candidate

  • Address of exam centre

  • Exam date and time

  • Exam day instructions

counselling_process.html_content:
SBTET is conducting the AP Polycet counselling in online (web-based) mode. The details regarding the counselling of AP Polycet 2024 are updated online at the official website. Candidates have to pay the AP Polycet 2024 counselling processing fees & complete the certificate verification for final phase from July 11 to 13, 2024. Candidates have to complete the document verification from July 11 to 14 after the payment of processing fees. 

After successful completion of the document verification process, the candidates have to exercise the choice filling. It is recommended that the candidates fill in as many choices as possible to maximize their chances of admission. In fact, to make the choice-filling process easier for candidates, cutoff details of the previous academic session will be uploaded on the portal. By referring to the last rank (cutoff details) the candidate can access their chances of admission.

AP POLYCET Seat Allotment 2024

The DTE Andhra Pradesh authorities will announce the AP Polycet seat allotment for final phase on July 16, 2024 online at the official website. The seat will be alloted based on the merit rank of the candidates and also the choices filled by them. To check their AP Polycet 2024 allotment status, candidates have to log in to the counselling portal using their login credentials. Notification related to seat allotment of AP Polycet will be sent to the candidate on their registered mobile numbers.

How to download AP Polycet 2024 seat allotment letter?

Candidates can follow the given steps to download their seat allotment letter:

  • Visit the AP Polycet 2024 counselling official website

  • Click on the Seat Allotment link.

  • Login with ICR Form Number, Hall ticket number, password, and date of birth.

  • AP Polycet seat allotment letter will be displayed on the screen.

  • Download the letter and take a print out.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The authorities have released the exam pattern of AP POLYCET 2024 on the official website. The exam pattern helps aspirants to get an idea of what the entrance exam is all about and what they need to do to succeed. AP POLYCET 2024 question paper will be of 2 hours duration and include multiple-choice type. Each question will have four answer options, out of which one answer will be correct. 

A total of 120 questions will be asked – Mathematics will contribute 60 questions, while Physics and Chemistry 30 each. Each question will have four answer options, out of which one will be the correct option. No marks will be deducted for the incorrect answers. Questions will be set based on the Class 10 (S.S.C.) syllabus. The exam will be conducted in offline (OMR-based) mode. Responses have to be entered by darkening the appropriate circle using a 2B pencil.

faqs.question: What is the syllabus of AP Polycet 2024?
faqs.answer: AP Polycet syllabus 2024 is based on the topics of subjects - Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics of Class X (SSC). Thus, the candidates should prepare for the exam keeping in mind the syllabus of class 10th.

faqs.question: How to download AP Polycet hall ticket 2024?
faqs.answer: Candidates can get the AP Polycet 2024 hall ticket in both online and offline mode. For online mode, candidates can download the admit card through the official website using their Class 10 Hall Ticket Number, Date of Birth and Class 10 passing/appearing year. To obtain the hall ticket in offline mode, candidates can visit the designated helpline centres.

faqs.question: When will the AP Polycet hall ticket 2024 be released?
faqs.answer: The AP Polycet hall ticket 2024 has been issued on April 18, 2024.

faqs.question: What is the marking scheme of AP Polycet 2024?
faqs.answer: AP Polycet question carries 1 mark for each correct answer and there is no negative marking.

faqs.question: What is the exam pattern of AP Polycet 2024?
faqs.answer: As per the AP Polycet exam pattern, the exam will be conducted as an offline test of 2 hours having 120 multiple-choice questions spread over the three sections of the exam- Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics.

faqs.question: What is the application fee of AP Polycet 2024?
faqs.answer: For online application, candidates are required to pay Rs 350 and for offline application, the fee is Rs 400.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria of AP Polycet 2024?
faqs.answer: Candidates must be a domicile of Andhra Pradesh. Candidates must have passed SSC examination conducted by the State Board of Secondary Education, Andhra Pradesh/ Telangana or any equivalent exam with a minimum aggregate of 35% marks with Mathematics as one of the subjects. Candidates appearing in the qualifying exam are also eligible.

faqs.question: How can I apply for AP Polycet 2024?
faqs.answer: Candidates could fill the AP Polycet application form 2024 in both online and offline mode.

exam_name: Delhi CET - Delhi Common Entrance Test
conducting_body: Department of Training and Technical Education Delhi

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Delhi CET 2024 - The Directorate of Technical Education, Delhi will conclude the Delhi CET 2024 registration process today, August 2, 2024. The authority has updated the Delhi CET 2024 registration link on the official website, tte.delhi.gov.in. Candidates who have not yet registered for Delhi CET 2024 can apply by August 2. The authority commenced the Delhi CET 2024 registration on July 19, 2024. Candidates must check the eligibility criteria before applying for Delhi Common Entrance Test. DoTE Delhi will issue the admit card for Delhi CET 2024 at the official website. The Delhi CET 2024 exam will be held from August 10 to 11.

The candidates are advised to go through the Delhi CET syllabus 2024 before starting their preparations. The Delhi CET exam 2024 will be conducted offline as a pen and paper-based test in English and Hindi languages. The total duration of the exam will be 2 Hours 30 Minutes. Students who wish to get admission in the various programmes have to apply for the application process of  Delhi CET form 2024 before the deadline. The Delhi CET hall ticket 2024 will be available on the official website. The login credentials required to download the Delhi CET 2024 admit card are the registration ID and password. 

What is Delhi CET?

The Directorate of Technical Education, Delhi conducts CET Delhi every year for admission to various diploma courses in polytechnic (engineering & non-engineering) offered by several institutes/colleges across Delhi. Delhi CET is a state-level entrance examination that offers admission into certification and diploma courses within Engineering & Technology, Pharmacy, and numerous different fields. To get admission candidates need to qualify for the entrance test with minimum qualifying marks. The authorities also offer admissions through lateral entry in full-time diploma engineering programs. 

The exam conducting authority will declare the Delhi CET result 2024 a few days after the conclusion of the entrance exam. Only qualified candidates will be eligible to participate in the counselling and seat allotment process. The successfully qualified candidates will be eligible to get admission to government and private polytechnic institutions/colleges situated in Delhi.

highlights.value: Department of Training and Technical Education Delhi

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The candidates applying for Delhi CET 2024, must read the eligibility requirements for admission processes to get admission to diploma courses offered by the participating institutes. The admissions will be based on merit. By checking the Delhi CET 2024 eligibility criteria, candidates will get an idea of whether they can apply for admission to a particular course or not.

To get admission, the candidates must pass the Delhi CET 2024 eligibility criteria. Following are the eligibility criteria of Delhi CET that candidates must meet:

  • Qualifying Examination: Candidates applying for the examination must have passed the Class 10th examination conducted by CBSE or equivalent examination board with at least 35% marks or 3.7 CGPA with Science, Mathematics, and English as compulsory subjects. In addition, candidates must have passed every subject individually.

  • Physical Fitness: Candidates must be physically fit and will have to show a certificate of physical fitness at the time of counselling.

  • Age Limit: The authority has specified the gender and category-wise maximum age limits. However, the candidate can check the age limit in the below table.

(Public Health & Environment Engineering), Computer Engineering Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, Digital Electronics, Medical Electronics, Fashion Design, Garment Fabrication Technology, Information Technology Enabled Services & Management (ITES&M), Interior Design, Instrumentation & Control Engineering, Library & Information Science, Mechanical Engineering, Mechanical Engg. (Maintenance Engg.) Medical Laboratory Technology, Polymer Technology, Printing Technology, Production Engineering, Textile Design, Tool & Die Making.

Candidate must have Passed class 10 or any other equivalent examination conducted by CBSE or other board with a minimum 35% or 3.7 CGPA aggregate.


Candidates should have compulsorily passed Science, Mathematics and English in the qualifying exam.

Group B

Diploma in Modern Office Practice (English), Modern Office Practice (Hindi)

Candidate must have passed class 12 from CBSE through any stream or any other equivalent examinations with minimum 35% marks in aggregate of the best three subjects including English for MOP (Eng.) and Hindi or Sanskrit for MOP (Hindi).


Candidate should have passed each of these three subjects individually as well.

Group-C

Passed class 12 exam with Physics and Chemistry as compulsory subjects along with Mathematics or Biology

OR

Passed class 12 Science with Technical Vocational Subject. OR

Passed class 10 + ITI (2 years)** with appropriate Trade in that order.

*The ITIs/ITCs must be from Institutes located only in Delhi and affiliated to DGE&T/BTE, Delhi.

application_process.html_content:
The authority will conclude the Delhi CET 2024 registration on August 2. Candidates can fill out the Delhi CET applications form 2024 at, dtte.ucanapply.com. Before filling out the application form, candidates must check the eligibility criteria of Delhi CET 2024. The application form comprises of registration, form filling, uploading images, and payment of fees. Below is the step to fill out the Delhi CET application form 2024.

How to fill Delhi CET 2024 Application form 

  • Registration: The candidates must choose the test (Test 1) and thereafter will have to register by entering details such as the candidate's name, parent's name, gender, communication details, and password. Candidates must also provide a valid email ID and password at the time of registration.

  • Fill out the application form: After completing the registration process, candidates have to enter all the details in the application form. Candidates have to enter the details like personal details, academic details, and address of communication. 

  • Upload scanned images: Candidates have to upload the scanned images in the prescribed format. The documents must be uploaded in the scanned image of photographs, signature, and left thumb impressions.

  • Payment of Application Fees: After images have been uploaded, candidates will have to e  make the payment of application fees. The candidates can pay the application form through online mode only.

  • Submit the Application Form: Candidates must preview their application form before final submission. If at any point, the information entered is incorrect, edit the details, and then after final review, submit the application form.

preparation_tips.html_content:
To qualify the Delhi CET 2024 exam, candidates are advised to make and follow an exam preparation strategy:

  • Candidates must go through the complete Delhi Cet exam pattern, marking theme, and syllabus as prescribed by the authority.

  • Candidates must divide the time to different topics so that all the topics can be covered. 

  • Solve previous year sample papers or mock test to understand what type of questions are being asked in the exam.

  • Make short notes and revise the topics every day.

admit_card.html_content:
The admission authority, the Department of Training and Technical Education (DTTE) will release the admit card of Delhi CET 2024 in online mode only.  Candidates will be able to check their Delhi CET 2024 admit card by logging in to the official website using their application number & password. On the Delhi CET 2024 admit card the details of candidates’ names, application number, and allotted exam centre, etc.

How to download the Delhi CET 2024 Admit Card

Follow the steps below to download the admit card of Delhi CET

  • Visit the official website

  • Click on the candidate login link (link will be updated)

  • Select the test number

  • Enter the application number, password, security code

  • Click on the Log-in button

  • Admit card will appear on the screen

  • Download the admit card

  • Take at least 2 print-outs to use for future reference.

Details mentioned on the Delhi CET 2024

On Delhi CET 2024 admit card the following details will be mentioned:

  • Name of candidate

  • Roll number

  • Application number

  • Gender

  • Test number

  • Date of birth

  • Category and sub-category

  • Parents name

  • Address of communication

  • Address of exam centre

  • Thumb impression

  • Signature

  • Photograph

  • General Instructions

counselling_process.html_content:
After the declaration of result, the qualified candidates will be eligible for the counselling process.  The candidates will have to register themselves for the online counselling of Delhi CET 2024. Candidates will be given choices to select their preferred colleges and pay the counselling fees in an online mode only. Thereafter, candidates will be allotted seats as per the choice made by the candidate. The seat allotment process will be made on the result and the score secured by candidates. After that candidate will have to report to the allotted centre/venue for the document verification process.

Counselling process of Delhi CET 2024

  • Payment of counselling fee: The shortlisted candidates will have to pay a non-refundable counselling fee of Rs. 500 (excluding GST). Payment has to be made in an online mode.

  • Online registration: After the payment of counselling fee, candidates have to register for the counselling process. Fill in the details like Aadhaar, PAN card, and personal and education details for the registration process. Candidates will have to fill the marks secured by the candidate in Class 10, category and sub-category, personal details, etc. Also, candidates will have to provide their test number, CET roll number, the application number, etc. 

  • Choice Filling: After online registration, the candidates will have to select a choice as per their preference. The candidates are advised to choose as many as preferences they can to increase the chances of getting a seat.

  • Allotment of seats: Seats will be allotted on the basis of a merit rank list prepared by the authority, choices entered by the candidates, and also on the availability of seats.

  • Payment of institutional fee: After the allotment of seat the candidates will be allotted the seat and will have to pay the institutional fee in an online mode.

  • Verification of documents: After the online counselling process is complete, candidates will have to report to the allotted institute for the document verification process and also to confirm their seat.

exam_name: Uttarakhand JEEP - Uttarakhand Joint Entrance Examination Polytechnics

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Uttarakhand JEEP 2024: UBTER declared the Uttarakhand 2024 polytechnic seat allotment round 2 result on July 16, 2024.  The authority updated the link for Uttarakhand 2024 seat allotment result at ubter.admissions.nic.in.  The authority announced the seat allotment for round 1 of the JEEP 2024 polytechnic  on July 1, 2024. The last date for reporting at the allotted institute, document verification, and admission was July 4, 2024. Uttarakhand Polytechnic counselling registration and choice filling for Round 2 was conducted from July 10 to 12, 2024. The authority concluded the Round 1 counselling registration process on June 28, 2024. 

The authority has declared the Uttarakhand JEEP result on June 12, 2024. Qualified candidates must participate in the Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 counselling for the admission process, which includes registration, choice filling, seat allotment, and reporting to the allotted institute.  The authority conducted the Uttarakhand JEE 2024 exam on June 7, 2024.

The authority has issued the Uttarakhand JEE 2024 admit card on May 25, 2024. Candidates could download the admit card for Uttarakhand JEE from May 25 to June 7, 2024.  The authority concluded the Uttarakhand 2024 registration process on May 15, 2024. The Uttarakhand JEE 2024 registration link was activated on the official website. The application form for Uttarakhand JEE 2024 was opened on January 20, 2024. 

Candidates can check the notification to know the Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 registration date and exam schedule. However, the detailed information regarding the UBTER JEEP 2024 candidates need to check the information brochure. Candidates who wish to get admission to the Polytechnic institutes in Uttrakhand have to apply for the Uttrakhand JEEP 2024. Aspirants who scored a minimum of 35% marks in class 10 with science and Mathematics as mandatory subjects will be able to fill out the Uttrakhand JEEP 2024 application form. 

Aspirants preparing for the Uttarakhand Polytechnic exam must get familiar with the syllabus first. The Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 syllabus consists of three subjects - Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics. Also, to improve preparation candidates must also follow the Uttarakhand Polytechnic 2024 exam pattern and attempt mock tests. The authority will conduct the JEEP 2024 in offline mode. 

Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 Latest News and Updates

  • UBTER has declared the Uttarakhand JEEP seat allotment 2024 for round 2.

  • UBTER has announced the Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 seat allotment for round 1.

  • UBTER concluded the Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 counselling registration.

  • UBTER has commenced the Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 counselling registration.

  • UBTER has announced the Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 result.

  • UBTER has announced the Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 exam date.

  • UBTER issued the Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 admit card.

  • UBTER concluded the Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 registration process.

  • UBTER extended the Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 registration date.

  • UBTER released the Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 registration process at ubter.in.

About Uttarakhand Polytechnic exam

The Uttarakhand Board of Technical Education Roorkee(UBTER) conducts the Uttarakhand Polytechnic for admission to various government and private polytechnic colleges of Uttarakhand state. Uttarakhand Polytechnic is an offline exam with a duration of 2 hours. Candidates belonging to the general category will have to pay Rs. 800 as an application fee.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates who will meet the eligibility criteria specified by the exam conducting authorities will be considered for admission. There are certain eligibility criteria laid down by the exam officials and include age limit, qualifying exam passed, domicile, and fitness. Candidates are advised to refer to the below-mentioned eligibility criteria before filling out the application form. 

Age limit - There is no minimum or maximum age limit for this exam. 

Domicile:

  • Candidates belonging to Uttarakhand are eligible for admission into the participating institutes. 

  • Candidates from outside Uttarakhand must only apply if they have passed the qualifying exam from the state. 

  • Those candidates can also apply who have passed the qualifying exam from an institute located in the state. 

Qualifying exam - It is compulsory for the students to have scored a minimum of 35% marks in class 10th with science and mathematics as compulsory subjects. 

Fitness - Mental and physical fitness is also a priority that must be fulfilled.

  • Candidates are advised to make short notes for Uttarakhand JEEP important concepts and topics. Candidates will be able to have quick revisions with the help of short notes during the exam days.

Candidates who qualify the Uttarakhand Polytechnic 2024 exam are eligible for the counselling round. The authority has announced the Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 seat allotment on July 1, 2024. The Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 counselling will be conducted in two rounds. No fee will be charged by the candidates to participate in the counselling round.

  • Scorecard

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
Chances of getting a good rank in the exam will increase if a candidate has knowledge about the exam pattern. The Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 exam pattern will help the candidates improve their preparation and manage their time. Therefore, in order to ace the exam candidates must get familiar with the exam pattern of Uttarakhand JEEP 2024. 

Uttarakhand JEEP 2024 exam pattern

  • The exam will be conducted in offline mode (pen-and-paper-based). 
  • The examination duration is of 2 hours. 
  • The question paper will comprise two parts - Part 1 (Mathematics) and Part 2 (Physics and Chemistry).
  • The question type will be MCQ-based (Multiple Choice Questions). 
  • Both papers will be of equal weight.

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Jharkhand PECE 2024 - JCECEB announced the PECE 2024 seat allotment for round 3 on September 1, 2024. The authority has updated the PECE seat allotment link on the official website  jceceb.jharkhand.gov.in. Candidates can download their PECE seat allotment letter and complete the document verification for round 3 from September 2 to 7, 2024. The PECE 2024 counselling registration for round 3 was conducted from August 25 to 28, 2024.

The certificate verification and college reporting process was concluded on August 23 for round 2 PECE 2024 counselling. The authority published the seat allotment result for PECE 2024 round 2 on August 13, 2024.  Candidates can access the link for the PECE round 2 seat allotment 2024 result at jceceb.jharkhand.gov.in. The authority conducted the Jharkhand PECE counselling registration & choice filling from August 4 to 9, 2024. The PECE exam- qualified candidates are only eligible to participate in the counselling process. A detailed notification regarding the  Jharkhand PECE counselling 2024 has been released on the official website.

The authority has announced the PECE 2024 round 1 seat allotment on July 26, 2024. The authority concluded the PECE 2024 round 1 choice editing on July 24, 2024. The choice editing was commenced on July 23, 2024. The Jharkhand PECE 2024 counselling registration & choice filling process was conducted from July 15 to 21, 2024. 

Candidates who qualify for the PECE exam 2024 can participate in the counselling process. To appear in the PECE counselling, candidates have to apply for registration, locking of choices, and payment of counselling fees. After each round of PECE 2024 counselling, seat allotment will be conducted and all the allotted candidates will have to report to the allotted institute with relevant documents for the document verification process and to confirm the seat at the scheduled date and time.

The authority has announced the Jharkhand PECE 2024 result on April 26. The Jharkhand PECE 2024 exam result was available at  jceceb.jharkhand.gov.in. Candidates could download the PECE 2024 answer key pdf from April 8 to 12, 2024 on the official website. The PECE 2024 exam concluded on April 7, 2024. PECE is conducted as an offline exam with a duration of 2 hours and 30 minutes. Candidates can download the Jharkhand Polytechnic admit card online.

The authority concluded the PECE 2024 registration process on March 21, 2024. The authority updated the PECE registration 2024 link at jceceb.jharkhand.gov.in. Candidates can check the PECE 2024 exam date online. Refer to the notification to know about the PECE 2024 registration and exam date schedules.

Candidates who have passed the class 10 exam are eligible to apply for the test. To secure good marks in the Jharkhand Polytechnic exam, candidates must revise the complete syllabus of Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics from class 10. PECE 2024 exam dates have been updated on this page.

What is Jharkhand PECE? 

Jharkhand PECE or Polytechnic Entrance Competitive Examination (PECE) is a state-level entrance exam conducted by the Jharkhand Combined Entrance Competitive Examination Board (JCECEB) every year. PECE is conducted as an offline exam and the time duration is 2 hours and 30 minutes. Every year thousands of students apply for the Jharkhand Polytechnic entrance exam, to get admission to various government & private polytechnic institutions in the Jharkhand State for various Engineering and non-engineering diploma programs. 

The Jharkhand Polytechnic exam is divided into three sections including Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics consisting of 150 multiple-choice questions. Applicants preparing for the exam must refer to the Jharkhand PECE syllabus and exam pattern for their PECE exam preparations. Candidates can also refer to the PECE previous year's question papers to ace the exam with a good score.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The exam conducting authority has released the Jharkhand PECE eligibility criteria 2024 at the official website along with the notification. Applicants appearing for the exam must check the eligibility criteria of PECE 2024 before filling out the Jharkhand Polytechnic application form. The eligibility criteria comprises academic qualification, age limit, and citizenship requirement. However, if any candidates fail to qualify for the eligibility criteria of PECE at the time of admission, then their candidature will be cancelled. For more details about PECE 2024 eligibility criteria, candidates can check below.

  • Citizenship: The candidates should be citizens of Jharkhand or should have a domicile to be eligible for PECE 2024.

  • Academic Qualification: The candidate must have passed class 10 or equivalent examination with a minimum aggregate of 35%. However, the candidates appearing in class 10 in 2024 will also be eligible to apply.

  • Age Limit: There is no age limit prescribed except for a Diploma in Mining Engineering for which the minimum age required is 17 years.

  • Medical Requirement: The candidate will have to present a medical certificate or physical fitness certificate prescribed by the registered medical professional at the time of admission.

application_process.html_content:
JCECEB concluded the PECE application form 2024 online at the official website. Applicants could fill out the PECE application form 2024 through the candidate portal. Before filling out the application form of PECE 2024, candidates must check the eligibility criteria. The application process for Jharkhand PECE 2024 comprises filling application form, uploading documents and paying of fee. Steps to fill out the PECE application form 2024 are given below.

How to fill PECE application form 2024

Step 1: Filling application form
The first step is to fill the application form from the candidate portal. The following details have to be entered by the candidates in the application form of PECE 2024.

Personal Details: The details like Name, Parent's name,  Date of Birth, Gender, Aadhaar number, Family income, Nationality, etc have to be entered in the application form.

Choice of Examination Centre: Candidates have to select the exam centres according to their preference.

Educational Details: Academic details like name of the school, name of the board, Roll No., year of passing, and percentage of marks have to be entered.

Communication Details: The communication details like address have to be entered here.

Password: A password has to be generated here which will be used in future processing.

Step 2: Uploading of Images

The next step is to upload the scanned image of the thumb impression, photograph and signature in the application form of PECE as per the specifications.

How to download the PECE admit card 2024

  • Visit the Jharkhand PECE official website.

has released the PECE 2024 round 2 seat allotment on August 13, 2024. exam_name: CG PPT - Chhattisgarh Pre-Polytechnic Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
CG PPT 2024 - DTE Chhattisgarh will release the CG PPT 2024 seat allotment for round 2 on September 3, 2024. The authority will update the CG PPT seat allotment link 2024 on the official website vyapam.cgstate.gov.in. The authority will conduct te admission process for CG PPT 2024 counselling round 2 from September 4 to 7, 2024. The CG PPT 2024 counselling registration for round 2 was held from August 28 to 31, 2024.

The authority announced the CG PPT seat allotment 2024 for round 1 on August 21, 2024. The last date to reporting of candidates at the allotted institute is August 27, 2024. The CG PPT 2024 counselling registration and choice filling process concluded on August 17, 2024. The authority has released CG PPT answer key and merit list on the official website. CGPEB  has released the CG PPT 2024 result on the official website, vyapam.cgstate.gov.in.

Chhattisgarh PPT model answer key 2024 has been released on the official website. Candidates can download the answer key of CG PPT 2024 from the official website. The authorities has released the CG PPT result and final answer key on its official website. Candidates can check the CG PPT results by using their login credentials.  Candidates could challenge the CG PPT answer key 2024 on the official website.

The authority has released the CG PPT 2024 admit card on June 17, 2024. The authority has activated the CG PPT 2024 admit card link on the official website. Candidates can download admit card for CG PPT 2024 from June 17 to 23, 2024. The authority will conduct the CG PPT 2024 exam on June 23, 2024. It is a  three hour offline exam based on the subjects of Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics.

The authority conducted the CG PPT 2024 registration process on the official website. Candidates need to fulfill the CG PPT eligibility criteria before filling out the CG PPT application form 2024. Moreover, candidates who wish to appear for the CG Polytechnic exam have to apply online. The application process comprises CG registration, form filling, uploading documents, and payment of the application fee. No application will be entertained after the CG PPT form last date 2024. 

Candidates who have completed the application process for CG PPT should get familiar with the exam pattern. The exam consists of 150 objective-type questions with a total of 150 marks and lasts for 3 hours. The questions will be based on Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics and will be available in both Hindi and English. Students will be required to attempt all the questions, as there will be no negative making for a wrong answer.

What is CG PPT?

Chhattisgarh Pre-Polytechnic Test (CG PPT) is a state-level entrance exam conducted by the Chhattisgarh Professional Examination Board (CGPEB), Raipur. The authorities conduct admission in Polytechnic courses in various offered fields. The qualified candidates from the entrance examination will get admission to various Govt. and Private Polytechnic courses across the state.  Candidates who have applied for CG Pre Polytechnic Test 2024 must ensure that they fulfilled the prescribed eligibility criteria. It is an offline exam of the duration of 3 hours based on the subjects of Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics. The Chhattisgarh Professional Examination Board will release CG PPT 2024 results along with the final answer key on the official website vyapam.cgstate.gov.in.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
DTE Chhattisgarh has released the CG PPT eligibility criteria on the official notification. Applicants are advised to check the CG PPT eligibility criteria 2024 before filling out the application form. The eligibility criteria of CG  PPT 2024 comprise academic qualification and an age limit. If any candidate fails to prove the eligibility criteria during the admission process, then their candidature will be cancelled. For more details, candidates can check out the information below.

Academic Qualification:

  • The candidate should have passed class 10th through (10+2) education system of Board of Secondary Education, Chhattisgarh or equivalent exam from any recognized board(High School examination with Mathematics and Science as mandatory subjects)

  • The candidate belonging to the Unreserved category should have passed any of the examinations mentioned above with a minimum of 35% marks.

  • Candidates belonging to the SC/ST/PwD category need to score only the qualifying marks to be eligible.

  • It is mandatory to pass Mathematics and Science subjects separately.

  • Candidates passing class 10 through distance learning or open school are also eligible.

Age Limit:

The upper age limit is 30 years for the male candidates belonging to the Unreserved category and 33 years for the candidates belonging to SC/ST/PwD and female candidates.

application_process.html_content:
DTE Chhattisgarh conducted the CG PPT 2024 registration process on its official website.  Applicants appearing for the exam have to check the eligibility criteria before filling out the application form for CG PPT 2024. The application process of CG PPT 2024 comprises registration, filling details in the application form, uploading documents and fee payment. Applicants are advised to keep all the documents ready before filling the application form.

  • Login to fill out the application form: In the next step, applicants have to login to fill out the application form for CG PPT 2024. Candidates have to fill in personal details, educational details, contact details, and other information in the CG PPT 2024 application form.

  • Uploading of Documents: After filling in details in the application form, applicants have to upload the relevant documents as per the specifications in the application form.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Candidates preparing for Chhattisgarh Pre Polytechnic Test 2024 can refer to the preparation tips given below:

  • Read the complete official notification of the CG PPT exam carefully.

  • Mark and make notes of the important topics of eligibility criteria.

  • Make familiar with the exam pattern and syllabus thoroughly.

  • Make a study plan accordingly and cover all the important subjects and topics.

  •  Understand your strengths and weaknesses and prepare accordingly.

  • Make short notes for quick revision.

  • Solving sample papers as a practice is a key to success.

  • Don't forget to revise the syllabus regularly.

  • Take the necessary short breaks.

  • Take a healthy diet and stay motivated.

admit_card.html_content:
DTE Chhattisgarh has issued the CG PPT 2024 admit card a few days before the exam. Applicants can download their admit card of CG PPT through the registration number. After downloading the CG PPT admit card 2024, candidates must check all the details mentioned in it. In case of any discrepancy in the admit card of CG PPT, applicants must contact the exam authority for corrections. Candidates appearing for the exam must carry one photo ID proof along with the CG PPT admit card 2024. Steps to download the CG PPT admit card are given below.

How to download CG PPT admit card 2024?

  • Visit the CG PPT official website -vyapam.cgstate.gov.in.

  • Click on the direct link to download the CG PPT admit card.

  • Enter the login credentials in the required fields.

  • Check all the details mentioned in the admit card.

  • Download the CG PPT 2024 admit card for future reference.

counselling_process.html_content:
DTE Chhattisgarh will declare the CG PPT 2024 seat allotment for round 2 on September 3, 2024. Candidates will be able to check the CG PPT seat allotment result on the official website. The  CG PPT 2024 counselling registration and choice-filling process for round 2 was held from August 28 to 31, 2024. Candidates need to register to participate in the counselling process of CG PPT 2024 for the final admission. The process of online CG PPT 2024 counselling includes registration, payment of the fee, filling of choices, document verification, and seat allotment. The authority has conducted the CG PPT counselling for round 1 in online mode. Candidates can refer to the counselling procedure of CG PPT 2024 which is described below:

  • Registration- The first step includes the registration process by entering the required details. Candidates will have to enter details like class 10 marks, date of birth, and CG PPT 2024 roll number. A password will also be generated at this stage which has to be preserved for future use.

  • Login- Candidates have to log in using the registration number and password. A pre-filled form based on the details entered in the application form of CG PPT 2024 will open and the additional required details like mother tongue, Aadhar number, family income, mobile number, etc will have to be entered.

  • Fee Payment-  Candidates are required to pay the counselling fee at this stage. The fee payment can be done online through a debit card/ credit card or Internet banking. No offline mode of payment will be accepted.

  • Choice Filling- Candidates have to enter the choices of the college and the branch according to their preference. The option to modify entered choices will also be available.

  • Document Verification- Candidates are required to get their documents verified to confirm their admission. Candidates will have to report at the prescribed venue with all the required documents for document verification.

  • Seat Allotment- The seat will be allotted on the basis of the choices filled by them and their performance in CG PPT 2024. The provisional allotment letter can be downloaded by logging in using the required credentials.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
DTE Chhattisgarh has released the CG PPT 2024 exam pattern on the official notification. Applicants appearing for the exam must check the exam pattern of CG PPT 2024 for their preparations. units.syllabus_heading: General properties of matter and sound
units.topics_html:
• Measurement, motion, and force: Measurement-measurement in international system of units (S.I.), tool of measurement: Vernier callipers, screw gauge, spherometer, physical balance, and stop watch
  • Measurement, motion, and force: Motion-uniform and non uniform motion, particle, body, distance, displacement, speed, velocity, acceleration, retardation, difference between velocity, and speed
  • Measurement, motion, and force: Force-mass and weight, inertia, classification of force, friction and factors affecting friction, sliding and rolling friction, advantage and disadvantage of friction, ways and means of increase and decrease of friction
  • Measurement, motion, and force: Force-importance of friction. Gravity and gravitational force, acceleration due to gravity
  • Work and energy: Work-definition, work done by constant force, kinetic, and potential energy
  • Work and energy: Heat and temperature-thermometer, conversion of temperature in celsius, fahrenheit, and kelvin scale. Specific heat, heat capacity, calculation of specific heat by the method of mixture, change of state, latent heat
  • Work and energy: Heat and temperature-cooling due to evaporation, humidity and specific humidity, heat expansion, linear expansion, superficial expansion, volume expansion and its coefficient
  • Wave and Sound: Waves-nature of waves, types of waves (longitudinal and transverse), simple harmonic motion, amplitude, time period, wave length, relation between-velocities, frequency, and wave length
  • Wave and Sound: Sound-nature of sound and its motion, range of hearing, ultrasonic waves, and its application

• Classification of matter based on chemical constitution, elements, compounds, and mixtures, types of mixture
  • Solution: Homogenous and heterogeneous, suspension and colloid, concentration of solution
  • Atoms and molecules: Dalton's atomic theory, modern atomic theory, atomic and molecular mass, the mole, law of constant proportion, calculation of percentage composition of elements in simple compounds
  • Atoms and molecules: Determination of empirical and molecular formula in simple substances
  • Structure of atom: Constituents of an atom (electrons, protons, and neutrons), atomic number, atomic mass, discovery of nucleus, Bohr's atomic model, distribution of electrons in shells (upto atomic number 1-20), valencey electrons, and valency
  • Structure of atom: Isotopes, isobars, isotones, radio activity, radio isotopes, and their application

• Light: Nature of light, reflection of light, laws of reflection, reflection from plane and curved surface, image formation by plane convex and concave mirror, relation between focal length and radius of curvature
  • Light: Determination of focal length of concave mirror by single pin method, relation between u-v-f. Refraction of light-laws of refraction, refraction by glass slab, critical angle, total internal reflection
  • Light: Refraction of light-use of total internal reflection in daily life. Converging and diverging lens, definition of focal length and optical center, image formation by lens. Human eye, its defects, and remedies
  • Light: Comparison between photographic camera and human eye. Construction, working, uses, and way diagram of simple telescope, and astronomical telescope
  • Electricity and its effects: Electric intensity, potential, potential difference, electric current Ohm’s law, resistance, specific resistance, influencing factors, combination of resistances, and related numerical examples
  • Electricity and its effects: Thermal effect of current it’s use, calculation of power, and electrical energy. Chemical effects of electric current, primary and secondary cells their properties and drawback, Leclanche cell, dry cell, lead accumulator cell
  • Magnetic effect of current: Magnetic effect of current, Oersted experiment, electro magnetic induction, electric motor, working principle and use of generator, general studies of alternating current and direct current, electric discharge in gases
  • Magnetic effect of current: Discharge tube, cathode rays, X-rays and their properties
  • Magnetism: Magnet and it's types, artificial magnet, methods of preparing of magnets, molecular theory of magnetism, demagnetization, magnetic keepers, magnetic lines of force and their properties. Terrestrial magnetism, magnetic storm
  • Magnetism: Magnetic meridian, geographical meridian, relation between V, H, I, and θ

units.syllabus_heading: Classification of elements, chemical bonding, reaction, and some important compound
units.topics_html:
• Periodic classification of elements: A brief historical perspective of periodic classification of elements, modern periodic law, modern periodic table, periodic properties in period and in groups, metallic, and non metallic elements, atomic size
  • Periodic classification of elements: Ionization energy and electron affinity
  • Chemical bonding: Formation of chemical bonds, types of bonds-ionic and covalent bond, electronegative and polar covalent compound, properties of ionic and covalent compound
  • Chemical reactions: Chemical reaction, formula of simple compound, equation of simple chemical reaction, and their balancing. Types of chemical reactions-combination, decomposition, displacement, oxidation, and reduction
  • Rate of chemical reaction and chemical equilibrium: Preliminary knowledge of rate of chemical reaction, fast, and slow chemical reactions, reversible and irreversible chemical reaction. Reversible reaction and dynamic nature of equilibrium
  • Rate of chemical reaction and chemical equilibrium: Acids and bases, pH scale, exothermic, and endothermic reactions
  • Some important chemical compounds: Method of production of washing soda, baking soda, bleaching powder, and plaster of Paris. Preparation of building material-lime cement, glass, and steel. Laboratory method of preparing alcohol and acetic acid
  • Some important chemical compounds: Properties and uses of some general artificial polymers, polythene, polyvinyl chloride, teflon. Soap and detergents

• Metals: Position of metals in the periodic table and general properties. Metal, mineral ore, difference between mineral and ore. Metallurgy-concentration, roasting, smelting, refining of ores, metallurgy of copper and iron, corrosion of metals, alloys
  • Non-metals: Position of non-metals in the periodic table, preparation, properties, and uses of hydrogen, oxygen, and nitrogen
  • Coal and petroleum: Coal and petroleum as natural resources, carbon and its compound, destructive distillation of coal. Petroleum its fractional distillation carbon tetravalency and catenation
  • Hydrocarbon: Structure and classification of saturated and unsaturated hydro carbons, homologous series, isomerism. Preparation and properties of methane, ethane, and ethylene
  • Source of energy: Conventional and new sources of energy, source of solar energy, causes of origin of energy in the sun, solar heating devices, solar cooker, solar cell, wind energy, biogas, fossil fuels, ideal fuel, properties of ideal fuel
  • Source of energy: Nuclear energy, nuclear fission, fusion, chain reaction, nuclear reactor, uses, and harms of nuclear energy

• Biosphere: Definition, ecosystem, and biosphere, structure of eco system, food chain, food web, trophic level, function of an eco-system, energy flow, biogeochemical cycle of carbon and nitrogen, biomass, biodiversity, and its importance
  • Pollution: Causes of soil, water, air, and sound pollution, and their control. Ecological balance, natural resources uses and conservation of renewal and non-renewable resources-water, soil, and air conservation, green house effect, acid rain
  • Pollution: Depletion of ozone layer, biodegradable, and non biodegradable materials

• Rational number and expressions: Rational numbers, irrational numbers, decimal representation of rational numbers, properties of rational numbers, meaning of rational expressions. Addition, subtraction, multiplication of rational numbers and expressions
  • Rational number and expressions: Factorization of expression involving cyclic factors
  • Surds: Rationalization of surds, real numbers and properties of set of real numbers, law of radicals, comparison of surds, addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of surds, rationalization of monomial and binomial surds
  • Indices: Laws if indices, important concepts on law of indices, definition and laws of logarithms, logarithms to base 10, characteristic and mantissa, antilogarithm, use of table in all types of calculation
  • Ratio and proportion: Ratio and proportion, componendo, alternendo, invertendo, and their applications
  • Polynomials: Introduction on real numbers, degree of a polynomial, sum, difference, product, and division of polynomials
  • Quadratic equations: Meaning and standard form of quadratic equation: ax2 +bx+c=0, a=0, solution of quadratic equation (i) by factorization method, (ii) by formula method, discriminate of the quadratic equation, and nature of the roots
  • Quadratic equations: Application of quadratic equation-application involving quadratic equation from several area, solution of equations reducible to quadratic form factorization of quadratic polynomials by using quadratic formula
  • Arithmetic series: Meaning, nth terms of arithmetic series, sum of nth terms, and arithmetic mean
  • Linear equation: Solution of linear equations in two variables and their application

• Trigonometric ratios: Sin A, Cos A, Tan A, Cot A, Sec A, Cosec A
  • Trigonometric ratios of 0, 30, 45, 60, and 90 degree
  • To find trigonometric ratios of 0, 30, 45, 60, and 90 degree by geometrical method
  • Trigonometric equations: (0º<θ<90º)
  • Measurement of angle in different system degree, grade, and radian, relation between arc, radius, and central angle
  • Trignometrical identities: Meaning of trigonometrical identities
  • Problems on height and distance

• Fundamental concepts of geometry: Introduction, point, line, and plane incidence properties of point and lines
  • Different theorems and/ or axioms and their converse: Of straight line and angles, congruence of triangles, locus and sum inequality relation in a triangle, parallelograms. Linear symmetry-symmetrical figured, axioms based on linear symmetrical pictures
  • Different theorems and/ or axioms and their converse: Linear symmetry-similar triangle, and circle

• Distance formula, section, and mid-point formula
  • Area of triangle, conditions for three points to be collinear, centroid, and incentre of triangle

• Area of triangle and rectangle
  • Area and circumference of circle, area of sector of circle, and length of arc of circle
  • Area of four walls of cube and cuboids, surface area and volume of cube, and cuboids
  • Surface area and volume of prism, cylinder, cone, and sphere

• Statistics and its definition: Meaning of statistics in singular and plural sense, raw data
  • Collection and presentation of data, arranging data in ascending and descending order, variate, class-interval, class-size, class-mark, frequency of a class, cumulative frequency of a class, class-limit, true class-limits
  • Construction of cumulative frequency table, inclusive and exclusive class
  • Graphical representation of statistical data, frequency polygon, cumulative frequency curve, histogram
  • Problem based on mean, median, mode, and pie chart
  • Preliminary knowledge of probability (based on single event only)

• Introduction, what is computer, working of computer, basic structure of a computer, constituents of a computer
  • Mathematical logic-statement use of Venn diagram in logic, negative statement, conjunction, disjunction, implication, biconditional, truth table
  • Binary digit system, change in binary number to decimal number and decimal number to binary number
